column6: Edy and Josh are the BEST bartenders. We had a great time, drinks were amazing! Have gone twice now and will definitely be back

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Super great ambiance and fun drinks. Especially loved the music and vibe. Didn't eat but food looked yummy!! And Josh is the best bartender!
bangin drinks from bartender josh. food is wild. vibez r popping  definitely bringing my boyfriend here

Cool vibes/decor and great drinks! I opted for the bird's nest since the bartender said it tastes the least like alcohol compared to everything else on the whole menu lol. It was pretty good and very sweet, not one of the best drinks I've had but in general I liked how creative the drink menu was! Especially as a Chinese American recognizing a bunch of cultural references in the drink names, and the unique Chinese ingredients that are mixed into the drinks. In terms of food, I liked the truffle mushroom salad the most bc the flavors were on point. Pork belly was okay to me, I felt like the portions were way too small and could have been more tender. Crab fried rice was solid though!

Food was delicious, and the vibe was great! We sat at the bar. Bartender was very nice, helpful, and knowledgeable about the menu. Great happy hour deals even on the weekend. Will definitely be going back again!

First time trying aguachiles- was blown away by the negro campechanos aguachiles. The habanero has a slow burn but it's the perfect level of heat. Also tried the Amarillo one which was also tasty, but has less of a kick. Loved the tostada de viera (raw scallops). The fish tacos had the perfect crisp. The pescado del dia Al pastor is also a must - it was branzino the day we ordered this and I was amazed at how they took out the bones while keeping the fish shape intact.
Loved the food and ambience. The service team was great but took off one star for the horrible hostess.

Quite the gem south of the Lorimer stop on the L! Outstanding aguachiles and ceviche, not to mention the most unique variety of salsas when ordering chips & salsa. Great happy hour deal as well (includes weekends!) most certainly will be back every time I'm in the neighborhood!

Ceviche was okay but the tacos needed more sauce and flavor. Margaritas are very sour and not the best in Williamsburg. Unfortunately this place did not live up to its expectations and that knocks out three stars each (there were peels left on the shrimp in our ceviche). Our server was very nice though, but would not recommend this place. Much better tacos and Mexican food in WB elsewhere.

This restaurant should be on every foodie's must eat list!! The restaurant is a seafood focused Mexican restaurant and if you've been a fan of Contramar in Mexico City, you will love Ensenada! The super highlight of the night for me was the perfectly cooked butterflied roasted fish that came with fresh hot tortillas. Can't wait to be back for another fun mezcal and seafood night.

As Mexican Americans, my wife and I can say this is the best authentic Mexican seafood we've had in the five boroughs. The tuna tostadas and Al pastor fish are amazing and our go to. We've added this place to our list of favorites in the city. We'll continue to be back.
A new favorite with incredibly fresh seafood, awesome drinks and great vibe. Amazing tacos and the patatas bravas are an underrated star. Love this spot

Absolutely spectacular! Our party of 3 got the scallop Tostadas, aguachile sampler, Branzino al pastor tacos and the hibiscus dessert. The Branzino al pastor were not just one of the best tacos I've had in NYC, but in my life (and I lived in Los Angeles for 6 years). That dish reminded me of Cosme's incredible kampachi al pastor, especially with the pineapple butter. My jaw essentially hit the floor after the first bite of the dessert, so complex and otherworldly. The service and drinks were major highlights too. Overall, would say Ensenada is one of Brooklyn's best-kept secrets and the trek from Manhattan is 1000% worth it.

Went here last night. Food was incredible - salsa flight, chips and guac were amazing. The guac was too onion-forward for my friend (who is a chef btw for what it's worth) but no complaints from me! Tuna tostada appetizer was next. Chef friend had doubts before it came. She thought it was going to be one of those teensy tiny one-bites that you pop in your mouth. No chef! The tuna tostada app is full of flavor with a surprise of toasted sesame and each is the size of your palm - many bites. Next up was the aguachiles - which is a form of ceviche (raw fish in broth?). I had the verde version - bright green, fragrant, herbal, spicy. Chef had the negro - deep brown, lots of heat, rich, spicy. We had smoky mescal and a couple cocktails, too. All of it delicious! Good service too. I'd definitely go again.

Food was amazing- the flavor packed in every bite was incredible. Service was also great and very nice staff. We ordered the guacamole, tuna tostadas, shrimp ceviche, fish tacos and patatas bravas. Already planning my next visit when I can do the whole order all over again!

The food and drinks here at so awesome - and so good that I came to eat here two nights in a row. This is fish-forward, authentic, super fresh Mexican food the quality of which I would compare to Atla. Everything I've had so far has been delicious, and I can't wait to keep coming back for more aguachiles!

The menu is uninspiring and overpriced ($17 for 2 tacos, $15 for guacamole, $13 for chips & salsa), and I couldn't find anything I wanted to eat. I decided to leave, but the server was very pushy about ordering something, although I can't blame her because the place was completely empty on a Saturday night.
I try to make it here at least once a month.Tonight was exceptional.The food,ambience,service and cleanliness of this restaurant is beyond 5 stars !
Fantastic! Great location, beautiful restaurant. Amazing food. The burgers are juicy and big... every dessert is delicious! Great birthday brunch with my people.

I chose to  visit on a solo date while visiting NYC. Because I was alone, I made a reservation for the more casual tavern area, and opted out of the area offering the tasting menu. The cocktail list is straightforward and approachable. Being an Indiana native, I was pleased to see the only non NY beer offered was Three Floyds Gumballhead, which is a classic hoppy IPA. The atmosphere is warm and cozy. It makes you feel welcome while still being elevated. Service was great, as I would expect from a restaurant of this caliber. Not being super hungry, I went staight for an entree and chose the Grilled Black Bass over parsnips and a smoked oyster chowder. The first bite was pure bliss. Flavors expertly balanced and it had just the right touch of salt. I do wish the skin on the fish was slightly more crisp, but it didn't take away from the overall dish. This was a lovely experience and I would definitely come back again solo or with a group.

I would not recommend coming here! It's honestly a pretty basic place with okayy food. I came from CA and had a full schedule of eating, however, this place definitely falls on the lower side. The service was quick, but I just felt like the chicken dish I ordered was not amazing or memorable. The duck liver mousse was very good, but the bread that came with it did not compliment it very well.

The tasting menu with the wine pairing was incredible! It was definitely really busy but the service did not lack at all. I came here for a work dinner with my team and would definitely recommend coming here for a work related or group dinner. The vibes were great. I would definitely recommend trying Gramercy Tavern!

Just came in for a quick meet-up but overall the service is excellent and the vibe is perfect. Have been here in the past and the food was excellent (I mean, it's a 1-star Michelin spot) but the combination of the location, service, food and environment make it amazing.
Delicious! trust the chef! Needs reservations. My third time here. Good for celebrations !

I've wanted to come here for years and was finally able to check it out last night with my sister. I started with a glass of Ridge Zinfandel which was amazing. I then had the Arctic char, the gnochi, the sirloin and the cheesecake. My favorite dish by far was the sirloin. The service was incredible, my sister eats incredibly slow and they didn't rush us. Really cool environment, feels like you are in a ski cabin. Can't wait to come back.

Amazing! Exceptional service and food. We were a little worried based on what the tasting menu had in it and we each ordered something different and we loved every item! Best meal of our NYC trip, and the staff were attentive to every need and detail. One of the best restaurants I've ever been to. I can't say enough about this restaurant.
I've ordered in many times and food is delicious & high quality. My order always comes correct and well packaged.

We had a great dinner in the Tavern. It's what you've come to expect from a Union Square Hospitality place -- a delightful, well run restaurant with well executed food. Everything we ate was good, and while nothing truly wowed, that is not really the point of eating here. The point of eating here is enjoying one of New York's great dining rooms. It's buzzy and alive and is the kind of place where you can be sandwiched between folks celebrating an anniversary and a solo diner having a burger and a beer.

The review is for the Dining Room, which offers a 3 course seasonal prix fixe menu for $72. Although fairly limited, the selection is well executed which is apparent in flavors. We had the celery root purée soup and pasta with roasted butternut squash and lobster to start. Pasta was excellent with just the right al dente toothsomeness.  Next came mains roast chicken and vegg as well as skate wing over broccolini. Both were tasty although chicken skin could have been crispier. The skate wing was exceptionally well prepared. Lastly, we had chocolate mousse and cheesecake to finish . Again, well executed and with flavorful detail touches.  Staff was attentive and attentive to small requests like bar potato chips with drinks. We opted for Bloody Mary and soft drinks to the $144 base. Total tab with tax and tip was $243.  Albeit a bit pricey for lunch, as an early dinner which this was, this NY classic is well worth a visit .
Short wait to sit at the bar. Enjoyed sipping on crafted cocktails while enjoying delicious dinner fare. Fun and engaging wait staff. Highly recommend a stop here!
Nice place to stop and eat with some friends. Too noisy for a date. Good food. Can get really crowded.
It's just too loud. The food is fine, I guess. I found it impossible to enjoy myself with so much noise.

I have always wanted to eat here. Several years ago I stopped by for a glass of wine but could not get a table. This time I made reservations 30 days in advance which is the earliest you can make them. All I can say is I was not disappointing at all. The ambience of the place itself is spectacular. It looks feels and smells like an English tavern. The wood fire on a cold day is very comforting. My wife and I both loved what we ordered as well. My wife ordered the steak tartare and I ordered the grilled pork shoulder. Both were fantastic. We also split the potato and clam flatbread. It was delicious as well. All in all I was very happy I went to the trouble of marking my calendar for 30 days ahead of when I was visiting New York so I could make reservations. I totally recommend this place. The service also is extremely warm and friendly.
Great experience at this Michelin starred restaurant! Service was great, and we felt informed and educated with every course.

Meeting a friend out of town and we decided to walk in here to eat at the bar. We anticipated pricey but wanted to give this well-known spot a try. The daytime bartender took great care of us and we really liked her! She said she was new but we couldn't tell. We enjoyed the cocktails and the dishes albeit not plentiful were delicious. The menu seems designed for couples to order several things to fill up. The service was quite wonderful and we didn't feel out of place dressed business casual.

I loved the burger and chips with dip here. So good. I also liked the bread. I did not love the blood orange flan with popcorn. The chocolate pudding cake was ok but not amazing. Really nice decor, friendly service. I would definitely return.

My friend really recommended the burger here, so I tried it. It was a bit underwhelming but everything else we ordered was delicious! The atmosphere of this place was also very nice. Really wanna come here with my family one day. The menu items seems to change a lot to. Very looking forward to the next time.

Yes it's pricey, but yes it's worth it!!!! We went for lunch and the interior is gorgeous. They have the perfect menu of items that are familiar enough that you can know what you're getting and that it's excellent, but unique enough to be worth the trip. Their table bread was different and delicious, we would up order ANOTHER round of their oyster sampler because it was just so damn good. The cocktails are delicious. the meatloaf was amazing. Everything. So. Good. Well worth the trip.

I wouldn't necessary go back. I have heard so many great things about Gramercy Tavern that I was expecting a lot. The dishes were were a bit of a mix...some were good, some not very inspired. The main issue was the service, we had to run after our server. We also had to wait over 40 minutes past the time of our reservation to be seated.

Eh. Not much more to say.  I've heard and read so many great things about this place, but it was honestly eh..... Two weeks ago we went and had a multi course tasting menu but I don't remember anything about it.  I literally don't remember what any of the courses were because they were all mediocre, not bad but not great. The service was inconsistent at best which may have resulted from them constantly juggling servers and sommeliers.  It was weird.  They messed up our first drink order which imo is perhaps the worst thing a waiter can do.
Delicious tacos and reasonably price Mexican food at Chelsea Market. Yummy! Highly recommend.

Make reservations days in advance otherwise it'll be a wait to get a table at this fancy place. The inside was beautiful, walls filled with art. The staff was inviting and efficient in their pace of service. I tried a torpedo cocktail and had the duck meatloaf togo. I was worried, strictly by the appearance of my entree, that it wouldn't be as tasty as I surprisingly found it to be. The meatloaf was extremely savory and not gamey at all, you wouldn't know it was duck unless someone told you. The flavors resembled a salisbury steak, oddly, which I truly enjoyed. Especially the grilled char marks, they brought everything together. Id without a doubt get this dish again which means i'd visit Gramercy Tavern again.
Great restaurant in New York! Ate there on a business trip and while I thought it was a tad overpriced, the food was enjoyable. I enjoyed the fall decorations as well.

Such a great spot!! We came in for some drinks and dessert and we were so impressed!! The bartenders were so friendly and nice and made exactly what I asked for!!  I'd definitely be back here again!! Thanks Gramercy Tavern

Sat at the bar this time and it was wonderful. The bartender knows hospitality and keeps service smooth while welcoming and unhurried. Smoked oysters were delicious and duck meatloaf was good. The only drawback was there were three children under the age of 11 seated at the bar. It took away from feeling adult. Very strange to seat children at the bar.

Are in the dining room with the tasting menu and it was spectacular from start to finish.  Amazing food with great service.  We did both the regular wine pairing and the reserve wine tasting and both complimented the beautiful prepared food and added to the tasting experience. A must!  It was a night to remember and would highly recommend this experience. I might also add that the wine list is very extensive but I chose the pairing and glad I did.
Really enjoyed the place. It was packed with Ben on Sunday night. Cocktails were great. I highly recommend the Multipass cocktail.

1 Michelin star, 5/5 service! Cannot believe I've skipped this till now!! Came for my b day dinner on New Year's Eve. Service was amazing and our whole dinner was really good overall!!! 1 star off bc my lobster a bit over done! Food was good otherwise and my cocktail was balanced and yummy! It's rare for me to find a place where I like both the food and cocktails so this is going on my repeat list! They accommodate for gluten free and was attentive about it throughout! Love the atmosphere and vibes there. Will be back to try brunch and will come back for dinner again!
Always a must visit for us when we are in the City. The decor , service and food is too notch.

I had just arrived in NYC on a Tuesday evening and we needed a place to eat and unwind.  (We being 2 friends and I) Walked right past it in search of another place that I found on Yelp that looked good but after getting our bearings and finding other place, decided it was too crowded and loud. Went back to Gramercy and while it was kinda loud too, not as bad.  Food was pretty good and it was close to our lodging. Our born/bred NY friend found it acceptable. Service was fine.

This has long been on my food bucket list.  I opted to not do the tasting menu and sit at the bar and order ala carte and I was not disappointed! The bartenders gave great recommendations and service was fantastic. I started with the seasonal bread which was delicious! First course was beef tartare with an aioli and it did not disappoint. Easily the best beef tartare I've ever had. Dinner was swordfish, which I was hesitant to order after a previous had experience elsewhere. The bartender recommended it and I gave it a whirl- it was delicious!!! Topped the meal off with a hot chocolate martini and chocolate cake. Will definitely be back to dine at the bar and will definitely give the tasting a try
One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Always come here for bdays, celebrations, etc. Chocolate chip cookie for dessert is excellent!!

I was really excited to try the Gramercy Tavern. Yes, the Michelin Starred Burger is as good as they say. The duck fat fries it comes with are the perfect compliment. The service is exactly as you would expect in an elevated dining experience. I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu.

Excellent dinner spot with a lot of eclectic cuisine but the portions were wanting and we ended up going to Joe's Pizza for a second meal. The best part was catching Manhattanhenge right after we exited.

Here for a luncheon to celebrate an engagement -- and what on earth could be better? Beautiful room, amazing cocktails, and every dish was better that the one before. Even the bread was special. The gracious helpful staff was the cherry on top!

Great food, art work and environment. It was an interesting summer menu for a Saturday lunch. Expected more light fare and salad options. Ordered a strange combo but it worked!!! Had the oysters (delicious)! Then a burger which was highly recommended. My daughter had the artic char. Overall , really, really great.

Highly recommended for discerning taste. The bar keep is well knowledgeable and to put it bluntly "OCD". They know what they are doing down to the details. Friendly atmosphere and nice decor. An absolute must for top shelf enthusiasts.

Lovely atmosphere and absolutely perfect service. My sidecar was on point. My husband's burger was delicious as were the accompanying chips, and my lumache was good. I liked the apple pie well enough but my husband was a disappointed with his pumpkin spice sundae, saying the pumpkin ice cream was flavorless. He left most of it. It is highly unusual for him to leave a dessert unfinished.  I would say my favorite part of the meal was our wonderful server.

This review is for the tavern room not main dining room. Excellent experience from start to finish. Service is top notch. Drinks are excellent- I tried a seasonal cocktail, spicy margarita, non alcoholic sparkling pear drink and tea. My review is 4 stars because I thought the food was very good but not excellent. There wasn't anything wrong with it but it just didn't wow me. We had to start flatbread and seafood sampler. Then to follow cheeseburger and brick chicken. For dessert chocolate pudding cake and the sticky toffee pudding. We also opted for a special lobster with caviar tart- this was my favorite thing we ate. Everything was very good but not wowing. Overall I would return and update my review after trying the tasting menu in the main dining room.

What a wonderful time we had here. My bestie and I both got cocktails to start . We had the tasting menu  in the Dining Room. Tiny bites, bread with butter, then fluke add the first dish. The lobster as the second (which was my favorite). Then tile fish, and the steak, which was my second favorite. A bottle of the 2012 Chianti for the whole dinner rather than the wine pairing, it was bright and tasty. Marybeth was our server- who we really liked, as she had such a sunny and cool personality. Dessert was strawberries and creams, of which I opted for the sorbet. Definitely five stars! Will come back again.
Always good service and elevated atmosphere. Highly recommend for special occasions and just because.

We sat in the Tavern. Best birthday ever. Made us feel welcome, excellent burger, great menu recs for desert. $70 per head including one cocktail, burger, and dessert. Sit at the bar for date night. Just a fantastic experience all around. We came here for the best burger in NY and were happily fulfilled.

Gramercy Tavern is a true gem in NYC. When we knew we were finally going to be able to go to New York for a post poned birthday celebration from last year, I made a reservation for this Michelin starred restaurant. Gramercy Tavern is divided into two areas for dining: The Tavern and the dining room. As you may imagine, The Tavern is a little less stuffy, but it's still refined. You won't find flip flopped /tank top wearing people sauntering in. Initially I had a reservation for 530p on RESY and was on a waitlist to dine at 700p. The host on the phone was very accommodating in that. We arrived about 10 minutes early for our reservation. Gramercy Tavern hosts make sure that you are taken care of, but not before checking your vaccination status alongside your ID. After that, your coat is checked and you are offered a water while you wait for your table. We were reserved in the Tavern , as I didn't want to have price fixed menu that I had seen as the only thing available in the dining room. Our host told us at 715p that the occupants at our table had not left and we could dine in the dining room on the ala carte menu, as well, if we wanted. We wanted to wait. At 745p we were finally seated. Yes, it was a bit annoying for such a stuffy restaurant as we could see empty tables that never had occupants at them, BUT we also didn't know if this had to do with a Covid rule or something, despite the fact that we are in March 2022. The hostess bought us our first round of drinks and that was kind of her, although she could have saved the quip about it being my husband's birthday as she checked his ID.. (it was last SEPT that I booked this NYC getaway for us as his Broadway bday gift and due to the pandemic it postponed repeatedly) ..so yes, it actually WAS a birthday celebration. Our waiter was amazing. He apologized for the delay in seating profusely. He brought me another champagne and who could be angry when in a Michelin starred restaurant in NYC? The ambience here is beyond charming; it's pretty and rustic but also very up tick. My husband ordered the best burger he's tasted and at $32 it better be :) I had the Duck Meatloaf and again it was amazing!  Our server never missed a beat despite our rough 45 minute late start to the night. The menu here is great.. IF you're wondering how and why in a Michelin starred place my husband would order a burger.. well,, because, why would you not try a Michelin starred burger and duck fat fries!? I'll be the one to go out and order a Duck Meatloaf because well, IT"s different! The waiter brought my husband a Vanilla Coconut Cupcake and candle (even tho we told him of the delayed bday trip!) and it was one of those cup cakes you don't forget. We tried to order something more to split but I have a myriad of allergies to nuts and apparently pea and nut flours are used in most of the desserts. That is perfectly okay for me .. maybe not for someone else wanting that full on experience! BUT for us this was amazing ! If you get the chance, make the reservation and get to Gramercy ... it's a legend in New York City and there's a reason why .. It's nearly perfect !
Classic nyc spot. Very nice ambiance,Relaxed but high end. All the items were great. The almond soup was amazing, really enjoyed the flavor profile

Went for the tasting menu and had a great time. Took a little over two hours but was definitely worth the price and experience. All of the dishes were wonderfully prepared and I left surprisingly full.

I hate hate that I am giving them only 3 stars. Gramercy Tavern has been our favorite NYC restaurant and we made a point to come back once a year even living across the continent. This time it was disappointing! We ate dinner in the dining room as per usual. Portion sizes were smaller and the service was ok. The artic char used to come plated beautifully on a regular size plate, this time it was on a teacup size plate. The steak was a teeny tiny piece and slightly chewy. The cheesecake was a circle maybe 1.5-2 inches across. Our waiter- nothing wrong persay but it was not the Gramercy Tavern I had known and remembered. I think it was just him. But I don't think I'll make a point to be back. For the money I don't feel it's worth it anymore.
The service was really phenomenal and all of the food was exquisite, and displayed such a wide variety of flavors.

I've always considered Gramercy Tavern to be one of the best restaurants in New York City. The last time I was there, though,  the food was a little too salty, and the atmosphere felt a bit tense, more of an institution than a cozy place to eat like it used used to be. I hope they can bring back some of that nuance that we used to come there for.

My friends and I have been looking forward to our dinner here since we made the reservation. Everything on the 5 course tasting menu was delicious beyond words - the flavor combinations, the diversity of each course, and the servers were so attentive and asked a bunch of questions to make sure each course would come out to our liking. The complimentary bread was also fantastic and I agreed to a second serving of them so fast even as we were getting full from the rest of the meal. It's so hard to pick a favorite but it might be the asparagus risotto (and this is coming from someone who doesn't even really like asparagus usually!). The strawberries and cream was also so good I cleaned my plate entirely even though I was stuffed at that point. The different flavors and the difference of texture brought from the ice and the almost crouton-like cake crumble was really the icing on the cake. We'd also mentioned it was our friend's birthday a day ago at the start of the meal and had forgotten that we had until they brought out a little coconut cake at the end that was equally as lovely as the rest of the meal. Kept thinking through the meal how much I'd want to come back and maybe take my parents out for a nice meal here :)
I only had oysters and a burger at the bar with some cocktails and they were amazing. The burger was perfectly cooked! Loved the vibe there too.

Two friends and I came here for lunch -- I got the duck strozzapreti, they got some fish entree (forgot the name), and we had island creek oysters to share as an appetizer. Oysters were good, pretty standard. The duck strozzapreti was for sure better than their fish entree which didn't have that much flavor honestly, but the strozzapreti was too salty IMO. In general, I feel like for how expensive this place is I expected much tastier food.
Had an amazing dinner, service is top notch. Pre-fixe menu was a ton of food unlike a lot of places in the city.
AMAZING spot!! Love how they switch up their seasonal menu. Such good burgers, oysters, soups, etc

We came on a Saturday night for dinner. Reservations were fairly difficult to get; we were refreshing the reservations page minutes before the reservations for our desired day became available, and in less than a minute almost all the time slots were taken. The tavern part of the restaurant is more laid back with an a la carte menu similar to what you'd see in any American style restaurant in Manhattan. The quality of the ingredients was definitely there, but price-wise I'd say it's a little overpriced for what it is; $40 for a hamburger after tax is pretty steep even for New York. Tables were pretty squished together as well. The entire night we were somewhat forced to listen in to a conversation between two men in the finance industry about their investment strategies...not exactly what we wanted for a weekend dinner. Overall though the service was good and food/drinks were good. Next time I think I'd prefer the tasting menu to get the best perspective of bang-for-buck at gramercy.

Gramercy Tavern strikes again!!!  We came back for dinner to celebrate another special occasion.  Today, there was a 5-course tasting menu, offered with or without wine pairing.  The food was extraordinary, as usual.  We were served a marinated fluke tartare with concord grapes, poached lobster with a basil butter sauce, smoked arctic char, roasted duck with squash, and a honey goat cheesecake.  Friendly and very attentive service.
We thought it was fine. But fine shouldn't cut it for a $200 lunch for two. The desserts were outright bad. Oh well, we can say we went.

column3: Old Las Palmas, Palm Springs, CA

column6: Chicory salad was delicious. Burger was solid, albeit bacon slightly overpowered quality of meat. Still super enjoyable with homemade chips and perfect aioli. Chocolate cookie was expertly prepared. Service was spectacular. Great to see this place still going strong, even midweek, after all these years.
one of the best in the city, Always worth it. But if you are doing the tasting menu (not eve sure if they still have it) be prepared for a long evening.
This might be dramatic but it also happens to be the truth: The chocolate pudding cake dessert here not only was the best thing I've had in my life, it also fixed my relationship with my father.

This place is a gem! I can't believe I hadn't gone before trying it. It was delicious and such a great place to meet up with a friend. We sat and ate at the bar but the tables look quaint and charming. The vibe is so pleasant.

Highly recommend! Get yourself a reservation for the tavern for lunch or walk in for dinner at the bar. Must have a cocktail, the tavern burger (best burger ever) and cookies with milk. Amazing service and insanely delicious food!

Mediocre food and even worst service. Went to celebrate a special day but ended up having a bad experience. We had a reservation for the main dinning room (tasting menu) but when we arrived we were seated outside until we complained. Food is not something to rave about either. Not going back.

The best I've had in the last two months is the only one that has a lot of pain and it's not really like making me sick but brown has been really good with me too and I'm not really sick and tired lol I love it all the time and I'm always so glad to be there for me and I hope I don't feel good about that lol I just got home from my work lol I just need a shower lol I love it lol I just need a lot more lol I just got home lol I just need to know what about to you get off work now I just got hit by the house I need a shower lol I love it

OMG we stopped in for lunch. Had the lamb, burger, chicken and the mushroom quiche. So good we made them all into share dishes! Focaccia was warm and delicious. Like biting into a piece of yummy! It dipped really well into the lamb sauce. Love it and will fav this place.

I've been to the Gramercy Tavern before in their Dining Room and decided to go to the other section (the Tavern) to throw my friend a birthday dinner.  I told Gramercy Tavern we were celebrating his birthday in advance and they wrote a cute note and a dessert which was much appreciated.  The Tavern is substantially more affordable than the Dining Room but I would definitely not call it cheap- and to be honest it shouldn't be.  The food quality and atmosphere are great.  My only qualm about the meal hence four vs. five stars is that, honestly speaking, I wasn't a huge fan of the burger.  It was super salty to me and albeit I do consume a lot of salt (don't do this kids! lol) it was a bit too much for me.  I had a piece of my friend's sea bass which was delicious.  I do have a soft spot for Gramercy Tavern though and will definitely return- they just need to bring back that absolutely fantastic goat cheese and bread!

We had such a special night here thanks to the wonderful staff and delicious food. Loved the black bass and the banana bread as a departing gift was a nice touch. It was an excellent place to celebrate an engagement and we will definitely be back! Thank you, Stephen, for the fabulous service!

Burger was our favorite it's just sooooo juicy! The dessert was a very close second. It was a caramelized cheesecake with mandarin sorbet and it was delicious. I didn't get the cocktails but they were all delicious. We sat outside and it was such a beautiful night in a lovely neighborhood. Great date night place

We did the tasting menu with wine pairings. For the price, the food was mediocre. Nothing really stood out as being very good nor was there anything particularly creative on the menu. The service was good as was the wine, but I would not come back for those alone.
Love the ambiance, great food and service.  A gem in the neighborhood.  Definitely get the burger and a glass of Grillo!!

During my dinner here last night, this place was on point.   Our server was top notch: attentive, personable, but not overbearing.   The food, oh the food.  We started with the beef tartare and the seafood platter.   The tartare was an interesting take on tartare and one that really worked.   Instead of having the meat mixed with Worcester and egg and other seasonings all mixed together, at Gramercy Tavern they served the meat next to a whipped mixture of seasoning and it worked so so well.   The seafood platter was raw oysters, Arctic Char tartare, and a hamachi crudo.   Each component was very balanced and well seasoned.   But enough of all of this raw food.  Let's talked about the cooked dishes.   The monkfish was great, but I want to talk about this "bucket list" burger, as our sever called it.  I really really love when a burger is stripped down and focuses on the main elements.  Bun, patty, cheese, bacon, spread.   That's it.   That's all this burger is.   While I am partial to a smash patty burger, this thicker beefy patty was utter perfection cooked at an exact medium rare.    We also tried the chocolate pudding cake and the sticky toffee pudding.  Both were really good but that sticky toffee pudding was really something special.   Oh, we also had an adornment of cocktails that were expertly crafted.  All in all, this was a meal conceived, prepared, and served perfectly.   I will definitely be back.
The tasting menu was delicious, everything was great and I loved the Arctic char and lobster lumache in particular. Excited to return and try the tavern!

Invaluable restaurant service! From their front desk, Mary assisted me nicely. She was pretty and perfectly suited for her jobs.  The egg was a nice flavorful addition.Great food with quality ingredients.  Had a friend come into town and asked me to take him here again.Delicious food and excellent service.

My favourite restaurant in NYC! I've eaten in both the dining room and the tavern. Both are great but have really different vibes. Go to the tavern if you want a more laid back, easy dinner; and go to the dining room if you want something more formal. The steak tartare was really yummy and the desserts are to die for. Definitely worth at least one visit while you're in the city!

Excellent experience!   I don't look snooty places and this was a great experience.  Very welcoming and great server with Mitch.   Food was creative and delicious but not pretentious or overpriced.   It is a great date night spot.    Thank you.
Good drinks. Had the tavern burger and the monk fish. The burger was very good but the food selection was a bit limited. Would like to try their tasting menu.
An absolute favorite in NYC. I love to dine on the casual side of the restaurant, or at the bar...love this place. And I love all the fresh flowers. The best food, in my opinion.

We ordered the pre fix tasting menu in the Dining Room. We opted not for the pairing because that would have been too much alcohol.  Not cheap.  Good flavor on all food.  Funny that my favorite was the bread.  Don't be afraid to ask for more.
Outstanding food and service! Excellent vegetarian choice, too. Can't wait to return. We are happy the restaurant is now open for lunch.
Really had no weakness. Rounding up from 4.5 star rating. Duck meatloaf was memorable.
Great food and good vibe.  The pork chop special I had was fantastic.   I've dined there with my wife and then did a group business dinner about a month later. I recommend.
Cutest interior and outdoor seating! Loved the pork shoulder and peach dish for lunch. Also their complimentary focaccia is amazing!

Returning to NYC after several years' break, came here on the spur of the moment on the Sat. before Father's Day with my two teen boys. Took a short walk from the hotel, called out to Ryan, the bar mgr., for three to eat at the bar. 20 minutes later, we are seated. We are treated well and served first-rate fare for a truly memorable, special meal. Even teens know when a burger, for example, is elevated to greatness. The starters - oysters, duck liver mousse - are phenonmenal. Interesting people at the bar, attentive service, a perfect experience for visitors to NY. The tab was pretty serious, true, but worth every penny. Eat here.
One of the finest restaurants in NYC.  Never fades.

Fantastic dining Tuesday evening.  It started with being escorted to my table by none other than Chef Michael Anthony!  It just kept getting better.  Amazing service, INCREDIBLE sommelier, and the food!  It lived up to my hopes as this has been in my list for years.  I cannot wait to return!

Michelin revisited the NY restaurants in 2020-2021and Gramercy Tavern retained its star. After an evening in the dining room I can see why. Gracious service, tasting menu items that were consistently great, and an elegant but low key space. Not sure if the naysayers reflect inconsistency in the execution, or the need for some to be contrarian, but we had a wonderful evening. Spying that burger walking through the casual tavern area, I confess I was a bit jealous. Maybe next time.

Ordered delivery and had a good experience. The Tavern Bacon & Cheddar Burger and grilled sea bass were excellent, and though it got kind of mushed in transit, the apple crumble was incredible. Obviously it's not the same as dining in, but I'll take it!

Lovely meal, I wish the portion sizes were triple because it was that good, I wanted more and more. At the end of the meal I was quite full. My least favorite was the sorbet paired with the cheesecake, it was way too tart and a lil bitter to my liking. I would definitely like to come back for the bistro section. Service was excellent and I absolutely loved the coconut cake that they gave my mother in Law for her birthday, it was the best coconut cake I ever had, so fresh and coco-nutty.

Came with a friend from Seattle wanting her to experience NYC and picked GT as I expected us to be treated to a wonderful meal with all the trimmings and wasn't at all disappointed! Every course, food and wine pairing, was presented to us with a description of each. Great service, food and wine-- couldn't have been happier!!
One of the best dinner tasting menu I ever had, amazing service, great choices of wine/ drinks. We really enjoy our food, friendly staff and knowledgeable. We will see you soon!!

It had been a hot minute since I had a meal in the Tavern. The last few visits were with guests and we splurged for the dining room. This time around I had a plan. Get there early (I'm old and go to sleep early now so it's easy), cozy up to the bar and go big with the Tavern menu. My hope was their ability to put together a solid dining room menu would translate to a simpler more pared down menu in the Tavern. It was a really good decision. Instead of getting mains we stuck to cocktails and did an appetizers flight.  It was hot out and we didn't want to be weighed down by a heavy meal. We got oysters, salad, corn cake bread, steak tartare, and dessert (+port).  For our appetite level, the choices we made were absolutely perfect to split. The oysters and cocktails were commendable. The ambiance there is world class and the service attentive but not obnoxious.Everything else had incredible polish and freshness (stone fruit/tomato salad) and chocolate cake. There's a reason why this place is one of my favorite restaurants in NYC and they demonstrate it every single time I come here without fail. It's rather remarkable in that way. Special shout out to the tavern burger I didn't get. My neighbor at the bar ordered it and it looks absolutely awesome. I will be ordering that next time I eat at the Tavern.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: One of my favorite restaurants in NYC and a true classic. Beautiful New York grandeur but relaxed enough to enjoy. My favorite experience is actually sitting at the bar on the tavern side for a weekend lunch. My all time favorite is their cassoulet.. exquisite..  This place is truly one of a kind!
Great food nice ambiance; went for brunch; service was also good; the golden beet salad and the brick pressed jerk chicken were both very good

(The Tavern): Definitely a Michelin-star worthy meal. Staff are all super professional and decor is both classy and welcoming. Presentation for all the dishes was beautiful. Started off with the chilled carrot soup, which had a really unique blend of flavors. It was a bit of an acquired taste for me; I don't regret ordering it but it probably isn't something I'd order again. For my main course I had the tilefish and I have to mention the seasoning here because the flavor was phenomenal. Finished off my meal with a cappuccino and the passion fruit soufflé. Cappuccino was wonderful, had that rich smoothness that comes with really good espresso, and I didn't feel the need to add any sugar at all. The passion fruit soufflé was probably my favorite part of the meal. Honestly the best soufflé I've had in my life-- super airy, delicate, and it just dissolved in your mouth. Paired very well with the roasted pineapple too. Portion sizes were such that I left feeling very comfortably full after 3 courses.
Impressive restaurant overall. The elegant yet non-pretentious environment, the knowledgeable staff, the food presentation, everything was on point.

I have said it before that Michelin's standards for restaurants in US vary quite drastically from that for those in Europe. Have never been disappointed by one Michelin stars restaurants in Europe. Well, this was the second time I was disappointed in New York. I had been meaning to try this NYC landmark for some time , finally did last weekend. The burger seemed promising. I asked for a medium should have perhaps gone for the medium rare as suggested by the friendly waitress. Nevertheless the burger was decent but the bacon was burnt black. I pointed it out to one of the waiting staff and he said it was supposed to be charred!!! I have had better burgers elsewhere in NYC, so not really exceptional for a special trip.
Great food. Excellent service and a very pleasant ambience. A consistently excellent restaurant.

Great restaurant! The dining room is great but wish it wasn't limited to the tasting menu. The atmosphere in the dining room is great and service is amazing. I have to admit that it did feel a bit weird seeing people wearing polo shirts and jeans even though some would consider it business casual, I think it seems inappropriate based on the vibe.

I love this restaurant - the seasonal menu makes it so you can go back multiple times and have a new and fantastic experience every time. It's one of my favorite tasting menus in the city - it's not exorbitantly priced, but the food and service are great.

My Husband and I decided to book a reservation at the Gramercy Tavern, and let me tell you we were blown away by the duck meatloaf!!! The service at this place was on point we were never without water, drinks, and smiles. From the moment you walk in, and from the time the bill comes. You are catered to and checked on to see if you are well fed, and saved room for dessert. We ate the milk and cookies and we were tilted! Our time at the Gramercy was memorable and we cant wait to return! That duck meatloaf!!! Why is it not on goldbelly already?!!

OK, Gramercy Tavern has been my favorite restaurant in NYC, since the first time I visited the place in 2002. That's 20 YEARS folks. Quite the run for someone who has lived in NYC now for 14 years. It's the food and the impeccable service which continuously keep me coming back combined with the fact that while this establishment is fine dining, they aren't stuffy and keep it authentic and natural. My last visit was 1/1 for a tasting menu with wine pairing in the dining room. Like I said, I have been there many times but apparently never left a review. My favorite dish was the lobster lumache with rock Shrimp, cubanelle peppers, tarragon. Revelatory! My least favorite was the smoked arctic char but to be fair, I don't generally like smoked fish. Also, whoever is doing the chocolate piping in the back for the birthday dessert has some work to do; Happy Birthday was a mess. You can't come at a baker with that, friend. We had two separate waitresses who were both stellar, though I have sadly forgotten their names. That said, every service member who stopped by our table with water or what not was lovely, absolutely embodied the brand of the place; pros. Thank you GT for always never letting me down. Signed - one of your biggest fans.

Third time around. Still worthy of the Michelin Star. Still satisfying portions. Still great services. Still delicious. Still not expensive compared to other Michelin Starred restaurants. This is becoming one of my favorite go-to places for a great meal.

We made our reservations back in November. Last night out of the blue we receive an email stating they are canceling our reservation so their employees can rest. I am all for letting employees rest, but this should have been thought through a bit more. Getting reservations in NY during the holiday season is very difficult. This was poorly handled by Gramercy.

Went for lunch, it was fine - but $35 for a burger is ridiculous, absolutely not worth it. Also, while eating at the bar, I noticed there were no floor mats behind the bar for the BTs; they work on a stone floor. I asked if GT supplied mats, and they do not. I complained to the general manager: you all should know better. Working on a stone floor all day, every day does a number on feet, legs, knees, and back. You are charging $35 for a hamburger - I'm sure you can splurge on floor mats for your staff.

This is definitely unpopular opinion but the burger here is way overhyped. I stopped in with my friend last week. We made reservations which I for sure recommend. Our waitress was nice and quick to take our orders. We started with cocktails. They were light and summery and delicious! They brought out bread which is very unlike NYC restaurants these days and I always appreciate that (especially when you pay these prices...). We both got the burger. They said it would take 20 minutes to come out but it really only took less than 10. They don't ask what temperature you want it at. It comes out at a medium rare which I don't like that much. It's comes with bacon, cheese and lettuce on it. The side is chips which in my opinion is very disappointing. I want fries! Anyway. The burger was alright. Nothing to rave about. The service was good and the drinks were good. The ambience is fun. But the prices are kind of insane. Good place to try once.

I booked the dinner reservation a month ahead of my visit to celebrate my birthday. It was for Saturday and I was excited as the only available time was for 9pm. The menu was somewhat limited. Service was attentive and during pandemic, they did a good job in checking vaccine proof and verified against ID. Pro tip: do not be seated close to the open kitchen. The air ventilation was extremely poor in the dining room. After dinner our clothes, hair.... smelled like a chimney, which totally negated the whole dining experience. I didn't expect that from a restaurant in this caliber or price range. I phoned the restaurant the next day and left a message with a receptionist and never hear back again. There are many fine dining restaurants in the city to choose from. I would not return again.
Nice decor. The table was a little small and tight but the service was very good. The food is really nice.

This review is loooong overdue. Been a staple for me when I lived in NY & still visit often when in the area. Vibe is always great, service on point & just a relaxing place to catch up with old friends now. Oh yah, food is great too!
Very nice ！The food is good and the service is excellent? The coolest thing is that they have both a "party" like front house and a formal dining area. Recommend for everyone for a try!

Food was good (on the saltier side the night we went) but for the price would probably would not come again. Especially knowing that I could get similar quality and experience for a lower price. Shout out to the waiters, they were very sweet
Service was EXCELLENT! Food was good but could've been better. Bread, chocolate cake, and coffee were basic. The lobster dish and vegetables of the day were very good.

There are not enough words to describe the excellence of Gramercy Tavern. I have been to places with tasting menus with wine pairings before and they were excellent. Gramercy Tavern went above and beyond. The atmosphere is intimate and the waiters attentive without being intrusive which is a tricky with a meal with multiple courses.  The food is delicious and the portions were perfect, not a dab of food with a swirl of fancy sauces nor a pile of food that you have to ignore if you want to make it to the end of dinner. The pairing were right on the money and made the food taste better and vice versa.  The time here enjoying the fare is well spent.

The service was fantastic! All the servers were friendly and kind and very accommodating. Everything we ordered was delicious! So glad to be able to squeeze in a reservation this place is always busy! Highly recommend.
Had a lovely lunch. Arctic char was wonderfully done with fresh vegetable (cherry tomatoes were sweet and tasty) and whole grain. Staff was very attentive.
A must for foodies looking for classic restaurants while in NYC. The food was excellent as was the service . A great place to have a meal that's very nice but not stuffy!

Two special days in NYC and decided to try Gramercy Tavern for the first time. After all the hype about what a wonderful restaurant this is, we were very disappointed. It was a very boring and unimaginative tasting menu with flavors that definitely did not sing nor did they even hum. Everything from the drinks, to 5 course menu, to dessert where so very meh. Not worth the money or time spent. Makes me question most of these recent reviews!?!

really good food and appropriate portion sizes. it did seem to move fairly quickly - once we sat down dinner just started rolling through literally until the check came. also it was incredibly loud but that is what happens when there are a lot of people talking loudly over each other all at once so kind of expected.

My wife and I came here during restaurant week since we had been wanting to try this place for a while. Restaurant week menu is fixed. It includes minestrone soup as an appetizer, mushroom lasagna as the entree and dark chocolate chunk cookie for dessert. The minestrone soup was very hearty. The mushroom lasagna was a perfect combination of creamy yet crispy and very filling (perfect option for vegetarians) and did not fall apart. The chocolate chunk cookie was huge! It was soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. A perfect end to a delicious meal! We will definitely come back again post covid to dine in (the inside space is beautiful).

Always wonderful! We went for brunch recently after not going for the last few years. Thankfully, they have been able to maintain excellent service & food and the prices have not gone through the roof! The food was excellent as was the service. Only one gripe- my wife order the potato soup which she loved except for the drizzle of Chile oil which was not described on the menu. Otherwise, a perfect experience!!

Overhyped and overpriced. The food was nice but simply not worth the price (or hype). The service was also very average. I had to remind our server 3 times that it was my wife's birthday. Ultimately the server ruined the surprise by offering us a desert menu (instead of bringing one of the deserts with a candle as a requested).

Outstanding tasting menu, flawless service and a lovely acknowledgment of my anniversary. Despite that this is definitely not just a special occasion destination. Lots of business meetings and date nights, family dinners and friends get togethers  but still special. Really worth the cost to get such high quality food and service in a lovely airy space.

We went to New York for a weekend to see the U.S. Open, some thing we love to do. Our friends have an apartment in the city who are complete foodies so they took us around for the weekend to the best restaurants. We had lunch here, we sat outside in the street. The only thing I would change about our visit, I probably would've rather sat inside in the nice atmosphere and air-conditioning... Not outside in the street. I had salad and fish as the main, everything was so incredibly good... It was amazing. Even with the restricted menu because of Covid, they nailed it! We even shared a dessert and we all felt satisfied and not stuffed, the food was just incredible. The fish was cooked perfectly, my husband had the beef... The sauce on each one of them was just as good, can't say enough. The starters were around $20 and the main dishes were 30-50$. Even though it's a little pricey, I would definitely go back!

We went for Thanksgiving! Always wanted to go and finally had the chance since we weren't having guests for the holidays and we were too lazy to do a big meal that day! First of all, the place is beautiful, the atmosphere was amazing, the service and staff was attentive and nice (and funny). Now for the food... though it was a lot, it was SOOO good! Met my expectations! The best part was we had lots of leftovers that we enjoyed it again at home the following evening!

Very disappointed. We had the tasting menu in the dining room. Three of us had it as is and one had vegetarian. At 165 pp food should have been more inventive and exciting. It was ... good. The vegetarian version was basically what the rest of the table had but they left off the animal protein, except for a strange course of grains, mushrooms and strawberries. It went uneaten. I don't usually write reviews but there are better places to break the bank in nyc. :(

Tried the tasting menu with the wine pairings and it was divine! At first was a little disappointed that it was steak and not duck as it had said on the website, but the steak was done so well i can't really complain

Only knocking it down one star because the service was a bit spotty. Our table wasn't ready in time and although the host was nice and offered to grab us drinks during the wait, no one actually followed through. We were then seated in the tavern area at a table for 4 (there were 2 of us) so we asked if we could move to a more intimate one next to us. No prob, adjusted. But it took a lot of time for our server to come over and place orders/etc. She did notice our body language and certainly picked it up thereafter but the food: omg, so good! And drinks were great. We'll give them a pass on the slip ups and would likely visit again.

Consistently delicious food, including for those vegetables-focused like me. Amazingly professional and warm staff. Cozy setting with food themed murals by local artist and fire grill. Everything is always perfectly executed.

An institution that I personally find highly overrated. I had the burger and it was good, but not the best burger of my life or anything extraordinary. I also had the pasta dish and found myself wishing for more flavor. The cookies are good but a little bit too sweet. All in all this place doesn't feel worth the hassle it takes to get reservations, and the food doesn't warrant the price point. I will say the service here is exceptional and always 10/10.
(Lounge area is a piece unreasonably formal for my style.) Sat at the bar and didn't think twice about it. A debt of gratitude is in order for a magnificent evening Leo....my barkeep.
The food was very good. Creative, well executed. Service was attentive and friendly. The reserve wine pairing was the best I have ever had. Incredible and elevated the meal.
Excellent service.  Had Chris as our main waiter assisted by Jason.  We had the duck tasting menu with wine pairings.  Interesting and well prepared.

Just amazing! I can't say enough good things about my experience here. I can't wait to go back. The entire staff from the front to the back of the house were incredibly friendly and welcoming. The decor was beautiful and seasonally decorated with lots of autumn things. I opted for the seasonal tasting menu with the wine pairing. Worth every penny.

Delivery was really interesting. I really love this restaurant. My sister even had her engagement party here years ago. But the takeout was really bad! Am posting what it looked like on food app versus real life. The fish croquette was so hard, couldn't even bite into it. Seemed like it was microwaved. Can't really justify $38 for this!! I hope this was just a one off bad experience.
The most wonderful place to have dinner the food always consistent the service wonderful
Once a great restaurant this place has been shot for years. Food is over salted overpriced and forgettable  skip it

It doesn't get much better than this! In many ways Gramercy Tavern is New York's quintessential fine dining restaurant. The ambiance is only exceeded by the service and the service is only exceeded by the food. Every element of the experience is perfect. We were a large party with an infant, but they never missed a beat. Gramercy Tavern is fine dining at its very best. We have been coming to Gramercy Tavern since it opened and we will be back again and again. Bravo Danny!

Delicious unique dining experience in NYC. Introduced to Gramercy Tavern from watching a segment on CBS Sunday Morning about the owner and his restaurants. They also incorporate a non tipping policy. Both the service and food was excellent. We had the three course appetizer, entree and desert for $134.

Always a favorite, whether the tavern or the dining room. The food is excellent, the atmosphere, while busy, is never too claustrophobic. The cocktails and service are a dream. We've even dropped by for lunch (on a weekday) with a toddler in the dining room, and the staff could not have been nicer - though I would not recommend trying this during peak hours, just because of how crowded it can get and how hungry little ones are! That said, I love how accommodating they are and the consistency of excellence - we've never been disappointed by a meal here!

Sublime! Came with my family for the tasting menu and loved every minute of it. The service and food were absolutely beautiful, and best of all, there was no music playing in the background, so we could focus on the food and each other.

Went on a dinner date with two of my girl friends and decided to sit Outside and enjoy some fine dining. We had boozy suzeys for drinks which was strong, but all the cocktails were about $18 just to give you an idea of pricing. We ordered the shrimp toast and the chilled island creek oysters with leek mignonette. It was my first time eating oysters surprisingly with a little convincing from my friend and it wasn't bad. I have texture issues so I thought I was going to freak out, but not too bad especially with the leek mignonette on top. The shrimp toast forget about it to die for literally. I will be Back just for that. My friends got the tile fish and the hanger steak. The fish was good but not a huge fan of the fregola mix underneath. The hanger steak was absolutely delicious. I got the brick pressed chicken and the grilled flavor was so good. I added a pinch of salt could be my palette but otherwise it was absolutely delicious and I loved the potatoes and pickled garlic scapes underneath,

A New York institution, Gramercy Tavern is in my top five places to eat. I recently visited for the new outdoor dining situation - Gramercy Tavern in the Streets. The menu is a smaller selection for obvious reasons, but still classic. The "must-orders" are the oysters, chicken liver mousse (light and whipped texture), and the bolognese. Tables were spaced well enough apart, sanitizer on each table, and it was a pleasant dining experience in true Gramercy Tavern fashion. Can't wait to return.

column3: Huntingdon Valley, Lower Moreland Township, PA
column6: One of my favorite restaurants in NYC and a true classic. Beautiful New York grandeur but relaxed enough to enjoy. My favorite experience is actually sitting at the bar on the tavern side for a weekend lunch. But you can't really go wrong here.

This is a one of a kind place. Can't say enough good things about it! Everything is delicious and they easily accommodated gluten free options for me. This is going to be our special dinner we do every year (would love to do it more often but we don't live in NYC and the dinner menu with wine tasting is definitely pricey). Thanks for an unforgettable dining experience!
Dumb.. just dumb!  Best meal I've ever had and a memorable experience!!  Well done guys!!!

My parents and I came here for dinner on my birthday. We were seated at one of their tables in the street and the lights and flowers set up were very nice. When we sat, my dad noticed his fork was dirty so we had to get a new one. We ordered three appetizers to share-the tomato carpaccio, the salad, and the chicken liver mousse. The carpaccio was very good, the dressing on it worked very well with the flavors. I also enjoyed the liver a lot, it was not too salty. For dinner, my mom and I shared the Campanelle Bolegnese and the pepper chicken and they were both great. The chicken was just a bit tough and under seasoned in my opinion but the flavors that came across were still very good and it was enjoyable. The pasta was probably my favorite, the sauce was not too heavy and I enjoyed it a lot. For dessert we got the gelato and the chocolate chunk cookie. The cookie was ok, nothing special so I would definitely recommend the gelato instead if you have to pick one. The gelato was great, so creamy and the flavors worked so well together so it wasn't too sweet. Our waiter was very attentive, our food all came out very quick and he also brought us some warm water when we were cold outside. Overall a pretty good birthday dinner.
Love this place! The food was excellent and the service was top-knotch. The poached lobster was incredible and tasted just like the lobster I've had in Maine.

Made reservations for Gramercy a few days in advance for a weekday dinner. It was a great experience! We were running late and also had dietary restrictions and the hosts were super accommodating and understanding. The ambiance is great (a little dark inside but it's fine). I got the only veggie entree option, the grilled eggplant parmigiana, and it was (a) very tasty and (b) a massive portion. It comes in a HOT cast iron skillet. There are layers of grilled eggplant, a delicious tomato sauce, and cheese. The cheese is bubbling on the sides when it arrives and the bits on the side got all crispy and burnt...so good! The tomato sauce was rich, flavorful, and very unique! I feel like a lot of marinara sauces, especially for eggplant parm ALWAYS taste the same and this one was certainly unique in a good way. It almost had some Indian flavors to it (perhaps the spices?). Eggplant was also well cooked and flavored! We also got the cheesecake for dessert. I really enjoyed the cheesecake, it has a great crust and was the perfect level of sweetness. Did NOT enjoy the sorbet at all though, had a funky citrus taste almost like fake candy citrus vibes. My friends really loved it so it was probably just a personal preference. Overall an amazing experience.

I was really excited to come here but the experience was lackluster. So many good reviews... we walked out feeling confused? What did we miss? The ambiance, food, entire experience was average at best. For the prices here, we expected to be wowed. I had the ravioli starter (had maybe 8 small raviolis for $30) and then the burger. Both were okay. If they had tasted incredible, that'd be one thing. But for the price, I would have rather gone to one of the many high end restaurants in NYC which go above and beyond. This city is full of impeccable restaurants, this just did not match up.
This place is great.  Great food, pricey, but worth it.  The interior is beautiful and the service is always spot on.

If you're not dressed to their liking they will make you eat outside in the rain. Hostess stated they were fully booked at 4:30 in the afternoon. Not one person was in that restaurant. Extremely rude.

Had a great dinner here last night.  Restaurant is beautiful.  We were greeted immediately and were sat at a very nice table.  We had brought in a bottle of wine so the som came to our table and decanted the wine, very nice touch.  Our server was the only low point to our experience.  Was not overly friendly and really didn't explain the menu, nor did he make any recommendations when asked.  He also did not talk to us about the drink menu.  Dinner was wonderful, with get flavor profiles that complimented each other.  We stated with the corn flat bread, very well done and just the right amount of heat.  For entree went with the flat iron - they didn't ask how I wanted it prepared but came out perfectly MR.  When making the reservation we informed them it was a birthday celebration.  I do have to say one of the best birthday desserts I have ever seen.  Delicate coconut cream cake on a little pedestal, was delicious!
I got Gramercy for lunch and wasn't too impressed. I probably had higher than normal expectations though since it has a Michelin star and ranks as one of the best restaurants in NYC.

Gramercy Tavern never disappoints. I have been going there since the month it opened way back when and each time I go I am amazed at how well run this place is. The food is always excellent and varied. The seasonal cocktails are imaginative altho I do wish they would repeat some favorites of mine like the Ginger Tonic. And the service is impeccable. The decor in the Tavern is timeless and the seasonal branch and flower arrangements are beautiful.

Came here for the tasting menu + wine pairing. Every dish was solidly executed. The service was excellent. The waiter was knowledgeable about the wine and dishes. The wine pours were generous. Overall, highly recommend.

Gramercy Tavern is definitely my favorite restaurant in the city. I've been to the formal dining room a few times and always walk away loving pretty much everything I ordered. The complementary bread rolls are amazing and they are happy to give you extra rolls. This was my first time eating the tavern food and it was also outdoor dining for COVID. I ordered the cheeseburger which was one of the best burgers I've had. The chilled corn soup was so fresh and seasonal as was the peach daiquiri which given how much I love peaches is probably one of the best drinks I've had at a restaurant. The peaches tasted like they were just picked. I hope they do outdoor dining again next year because the street was closed off from cars and it was really quiet and pretty.

This review is based solely on the reservationist/reservation system at The Gramercy Tavern. I have been trying to get a reservation for The Tavern online for the past couple of days but apparently the online system doesn't work. I eventually woke up early as I am in Europe and called the Tavern today November the 11th for a booking from anywhere between the 27th Nov-3rd December (three weeks in advance ) and was told that the only availability would be on the 4th of December (the day after we left ), no mention of a waitlist whatsoever, as I am sure someone will cancel. Why make it so hard for people to book ? or do you only get a booking if you know someone at this place ? . The reservationist also sounded like she drank the cool aid. I go to many restaurants as for half of the year I am traveling and always eat out at amazing restaurants that are accommodating , big disappointment by the Tavern !
The food is good.service is nice. But the chair is really uncomfortable. The dessert and the pork dish (main dish) is delicious.

I have come to Gramercy Tavern for 20 years and have always loved it. I came tonight for my wedding anniversary, and I was rushed and treated tonight like it was a factory like Shake Shack from the moment we sat down. When we explained our dietary restrictions, they said fine but then disregarded them during the meal. It was sad as was always one of NYC's finest that we enjoyed on special occasions and no longer feel they care about anything except filling the room during covid.

Oldie and still a goodie.  One of the farm to table pioneers that has the formula down pat.  Duck liver mousse with toast is a good start and the clam flat bread is very tasty.  Grilled lamb entree is fine but overall, even though the meal is good but not great, this spot is still worth a visit because the Tavern Burger holds its own with some of the best burgers in the city.
Had the tasting manu here for a birthday dinner and it was the best meal i've had in NYC! Definitely a splurge but worth it

Gramercy Tavern is as relevant a restaurant as it has ever been. Excellent was the base line for each of the five courses on the tasting menu in the dining room. Service was flawless. The attention to detail for the non-alcoholic beverage offerings is unparalleled.
Not mind blowing or anything but I had a great time. We had 5 course tasting menu. Service was great. It's been a while but if I remember correctly, they gave us some breakfast to take home.

Went here for lunch since bf wanted to try them for the longest time. Both of us agree on giving them 5 stars for service, food and ambiance. Everything we had was delicious and perfectly executed. They start you with a free focaccia bread that has cheese, thyme and peach on it which was savory. We got the roasted oysters, sea bass, duck sausage, sides of braised greens and squash. For desserts, we got the peach cobbler and pumpkin beignets which size is good for 2 people. I'm glad it's not your typical american meal. It has it's uniqueness and all the ingredients tasted fresh. Planning to come back soon to try their famous burger and the dinner menu. Definitely worth the price tag since the tip is included already.

If you have the money to splurge then come here for the tasting menu. On my visit the place was packed so that tells you something. The food is really good. As with all high end restaurants the service is over the top. They take good care of you. They also have a seperate dining room which is less pricey and just as busy.

Checking this off my bucket list. 3 coarse prefix dinner in the dining room. I was expecting to be blown away by the food and flavor profiles and presentation but I wasn't. First coarse smoked trout. The prettiest of the dishes, delicate tasty. Second coarse pork loin and belly, bland and sad presentation. Third coarse cookies and milk, 2 thick cookies with more of a cake consistency.. these did not work for me. This place is so hyped up as one of the top fine dining restaurants in nyc. I wasn't impressed.

For our 27th anniversary we dined at Gramercy Tavern last night. From reservation confirmation through departing at the end everything was perfect.  We had the vegetable and special menus with parings, started with great cocktails and wine.  The only thing better than the perfectly balanced bites and surprising combinations was the service.  What a great dining room and staff including the sommelier.  This is our new go to every time we return.  Thank you for an amazing night and wonderful experience.

Gramercy Tavern has been my go to spot for the past 9 years. I've always had my SO take me here even as much as once a month to celebrate as we live in the area. This year my sister treated me to a birthday lunch so it was the first time I saw the receipt (she left it on her counter by mistake) and I was appalled that they don't give free refills on a $5.50 Diet Coke. I am fine paying $40 for a great burger and and overall fine paying $140 for a great lunch but DO NOT NICKLE AND DIME ME!! A $5.50 Diet Coke should come with refills I don't care what type of restaurant it is. I'm not sure I'll be back- just so annoyed by this!

There is nothing I can say here that hasn't already been said by the other 2500 plus reviews. Our meal was wonderful, and beautifully prepared. Seasonal tasting menu was a bit fish heavy, and none of us is too crazy about fish, so we ordered from the three course menu. It's difficult to get reservations here but when you eat the food, you know why that is.

Never been here before but this quickly is now on my favorite places in NYC. The ambience with the tree branches and the table in the back are absolutely beautiful! Didn't try any food - but the drinks and the service at the bar were fabulous! My boyfriend wasn't feeling well, and the bartender made him his own drink with bitters and ginger ale. It definitely made him feel better! I cannot wait to come back to the city and visit this place! 5 stars for sure.
My favorite restaurant in all of NYC! They are always so great and accommodate my food allergies.

GT is normally my favorite; go to restaurants anywhere in the world.  Unfortunately, the last couple of experiences have been tarnished immensely by one of the bartenders.  If you are served at the bar, beware of potential rude and boorish service from this particular "professional".
Loved the atmosphere, the staff, the wine selections, and the food! What we especially loved was the beet salad and the cookie desert! The duck meatloaf was okay, but the swordfish was fantastic!

What a wonderful experience. My boyfriend and I spent a spectacular night tasting delicious foods and enjoy great service. We had high expectations for this restaurant and it exceeded everything we thought. If you are looking for a romantic night out with the best bread and food, then this is the place to go.

I would give this 3.5 stars. Food was decent, however I was expecting to be blown away so I left somewhat disappointed. The best dish of the night was the chilled cucumber soup (not pictured). It was super light and refreshing yet still slightly creamy. It was the perfect summertime soup, extremely mellow and cool. For our entrees we ordered the bolognese and cioppino. The bolognese was very good (4/5). It was very meaty and satisfying and the pasta was cooked perfectly. However, the cioppino was disappointing. For a $39 dish, the portion was extremely small. I'm used to small portions in fine dining restaurants but this was slightly absurd. It came with one scallop, one shrimp, a few pieces of squid and some lackluster vegetables. Furthermore, When I order a cioppino, I'm expecting a very impressive and flavorful broth. This broth was quite bland and had none of the umami I'm used to. The wine and cocktails we ordered were very good and the service was exceptional. However, the cioppino really put a damper on dinner. Perhaps we should have just stuck with the burger.

This is a nice restaurant if you are looking for a tavern style meal with a full bar.  The bar area is small and can be quite full at early dinner time, so plan on an early arrival if you want a seat.  The tavern does not accept reservations which is not ideal.  The wait time was only about 15-20 minutes at 3:30pm.  Food was good, but menu options were small.  The menu has seasonal options.  There were some vegetarian options.  Cocktails were a bit pricey.  There were high end alcohol options for those seeking a nice wine or spirit.  The service was good.  Atmosphere was a bit noisy but tasteful decorated.  Gratuity was included on the bill which was nice.  This is not a family friendly restaurant.  Restaurant is not handicapped accessible.

Came here on my lunch break with a colleague. Beautiful place with impeccable service. My colleague ordered the burger and I ordered their lunch special - soup and a wagyu beef sandwich. Both were delicious - will definitely be back again. Two mains cost me $68 in total, tax and service included. Got there on a Monday at just 12pm with no reservation and it was fine.

"top-class" dining with "no gimmicks" at Danny Meyer's enduring Flatiron New American, where chef Michael Anthony's "outstanding" set menus are presented by "eminently suave" staffers in an "upscale-country" dining room arrayed with "gorgeous" flower displays; it's "not cheap by any means", though the front tavern offers a "reasonable" à la carte menu in a "colorful" walk-in setting; P.S. gratuity is now built into menu prices.

Five star experience by far! I would totally recommend! The food blew our expectations away! We came here for our honeymoon, and Gramercy Tavern treated us so well! Check out our pictures! Will D, one of the chefs there  was amazing to us! Thank you!
4 stars for the food, 5 stars for service.  The burger was average, the apps were good.  We'll try it again but it didn't live up to the hype

Never disappointing. Pricey but worth every penny. Great service, amazing sommelier, i would go a la carte, the tasting menu is great but small portions. Go for The Tavern menu. My last meal could be the carmelized cheesecake!!

Our experience here can be summed up in one word: amazing! From the cocktails to the entrees and dessert everything exceeded expectations. The service staff, especially Josh, made us feel welcomed and were so so so nice! Josh is an expert when it comes to the wine and the entire menu! We will definitely be returning soon!
Always has amazing food from a large menu. Can eat there any time of the day! Quick service too
