Returned. Same experience with better more elegant food. It has gotten pricier but for a special occasion it's fair.

Exquisite. Everything was perfect. I'm so happy to have spent my 21st birthday here. Every course was so flavorful and each one got better and better with every bite. The wine pairings were so well selected and presentations were genuinely enjoyable. Made the reservation about 28 days before and it was absolutely worth it. I cannot wait to come back to the dining area, but until then I'll definitely visit the tavern area as a new 21 year old!

Came here with my wife and was so incredibly impressed! Have been wanting to try this place for a while and I can tell you it really didn't disappoint. The Wood Fired Tilefish, Lamb Tripoline, and Caramelized Cheesecake absolutely floored us. The Double Chicken Broth, was also a bit a  hidden gem on the menu. The service was excellent and we felt right at home. We'll definitely plan on returning.

Ok so I don't usually write reviews, but I think this is my all time favorite dining experience I've EVER had in New York. If you want to talk about service above and beyond, with equally incredible food, this is the place for you. Shout out to Haley! Everything was to die for and the staff was truly the nicest. Can't wait to come back!

The bread with the goat cheese is really good. I can eat that all day. I got the three choice course meal. The beef tartare and lamb loin was good it was prepared well. The Lamb was perfectly cooked medium rare. Beef tartare sauce taste like a salsa I had a Mexican place before. The dessert was okay. I think I would come back to try their taste menu. Drinks were good.

One of the best meals. The amuse bouche was buttery and a great compliment to the bread they supplied. It's going to sound crazy but our amberjack appetizer tasted like fruit loops and it was amazing. The lobster was cooked perfectly and was not chewy. The salmon was perfectly cooked as well and one of the best I've ever had. The mushroom tortiglioni was a bit on the salty aide but was still tasty. The duck breast was great and so were all the desserts. Highly recommend trying their tasting menu.

Wow! A meal at Gramercy Tavern feels like a staycation. The restaurant's interior is tastefully decorated with greenery and flowers, and the staff is so friendly and accommodating. I dined at the bar, and they were very attentive - constantly filling my water and making sure I didn't need anything. I started with rose and a complimentary bread (blueberry cheddar in this case), both of which were fantastic. For my meal, I had the burger. It was delectably juicy, and the chips were well-seasoned and crisp. Don't be too scared of the prices - gratuity is included! Whether it's date night or you're catching up with a friend, GT provides a luxurious dining experience with a seasonally appropriate menu and great wine selection!
Definitely one of the must go places in ny!! The burger is amazing! It's a bit expensive but it will be worth it! In the tavern they don't accept reservation, it's only walk in.

Not what it was. Food was very good but a tad skimpy (had 5 course tasting menu for $175). No bread, no palate cleanser, no petit fours. Bathroom grout was nasty and walls have seen better days. Staff was competent (although a bit scruffy/casual) but I've have equally competent service at mid-range restaurants. Need to up their attention to details.

Eh. Went to the bar portion and despite the excellent service I was underwhelmed. The broccoli salad was the best thing we had but the oysters, tartare, steak, and duck pasta dish were pretty average. Food was a 3/5 for me and I bumped it up for the service.

TOTALLY OVERRATED. So many wonderful reviews, so I thought that gramercy tavern was going to be a hit. Sadly, it was a giant miss. My son had the double broth and dumpling soup. The broth was decent but there were only four teeny tiny dumplings. For an appetizer, I had the asparagus and scallion pancake. It was very "herby". It was like the chef had put scallion cream cheese on top of a pancake and then topped it all with sliced asparagus. After the apps, I thought, this has to get better. It did not. For our main meals, my son got the lamb Tripoline (this was a pasta dish). He was so disappointed. It was not tasty at all and had a slightly burnt flavor. For my main dish, I got the eggplant. It was AWFUL. Mushy. The flavor was so smoky that there was nothing else to taste. Sigh. Did I mention that the meal was super expensive, too? We each at three or four bites of our main dishes and gave up. There are SO MANY AMAZING RESTAURANTS in NYC and this restaurant is definitely NOT one of them.

Unfortunately, a less than stellar experience here. Gramercy Tavern used to be one of my favorite restaurants. I hadn't been here since pre-covid and frankly, I was disappointed. They used to have a wide selection of breads that you could choose from, but now they just give a cold, not so tasty brioche.  Shrimp toast was a tiny portion for $18. Entrees were oversalted. We had the hanger steak, the duck pasta, and the tilefish. Tilefish was probably the best of the three. And dessert was $16 for a chocolate pudding cake that was literally three spoonfuls...I was quite shocked by the portion size. I don't remember leaving Gramercy Tavern hungry, but did so this time.

I love this place and always enjoy sitting at the bar with a glass of wine, however, food has been a bit of a disappointment. I tried Gramercy burger last time I was there and it was nothing special, definitely had better. Today I tried duck liver mousse which was very creamy with no taste and the toast was very salty. Great place for drinks and probably for sit down dinner but food served at the bar is not the best one.
Lobster Salad was such a delicious starter. We had the Grilled & Braised Pork which was a perfect fall dish and the Campanelle Bolognese which was also delicious.
Always a good experience when I dine here! Alvaro is fantastic! The service and attention to detail are excellent! Thank you!

I have to admit, Gramercy Tavern was really phenomenal. The atmosphere is a delight. My friend got Amuse Bouche Rock Shrimp, which I tried and also liked. It was so flavorful. And employees were extremely polite and courteous. Gramercy Tavern I'm telling all my friends to check you out.

My first time was 12/2013 and I gave them a 3. Unfortunately I wasn't detailed as to why. Just said I was underwhelmed. This time, 9/8/17 I had a totally different experience at the bar. Service was perfect.  Ordered the grilled calamari sofrito which was super tasty. The Cavatelli pasta was insanely yummy, the sauce could go with anything! The grilled lamb with sausage and greens was great too. A far better flavor profile experience than four years ago. I'll be back!
Beautiful dining room and delicious food. The cocktail was excellent as well (En Maison - whisky and fortified wine).

One of the best meals my wife and I have had in quite some time. The staff is very warm and professional and the decor would be what I would call a combination of sophisticated with a few rustic tones. We were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and were greeted with a glass of champagne and also added a complimentary dessert.  You can dine ala carte but we opted for the seasonal tasting menu.  The five courses consisted of fluke, smoked arctic char (which was our star of the night), squid ink and lobster pasta, duck, and a caramelized pear dessert.  We could not find a single thing to complain about and will certainly be returning.
Great food and service but definitely a bit pricey.

Words can't describe how wonderful our dining experience was. The food and drinks were outstanding, the service was second to none and the atmosphere was beautiful and welcoming. We finished our meal hours ago and have not stopped talking about how special our night dining at Gramercy Tavern was. It is easily in our top 2 favorite meals of all time. We will recommend this to everyone we know when asked about a must dine spot in NYC.

Really great brunch and mimosas, and perfect location near Gramercy Park! I also love the jam they bring out with the cornbread in the fall - such a nice touch. The takeout was not as good as sitting in restaurant and I was disappointed in the cauliflower (pretty bland for the price) but in-person dining is great and I'll definitely be back.

How this isn't a 3-star Michelin restaurant is beyond me. The service is impeccable. Friendly, knowledgeable, accommodating and unobtrusive. The food is incredible. The 5-course pre-fixe we had last night was as good as any meal I've ever had. Been here several times. It never disappoints.

Incredible experience at Gramercy Tarvern! We went for my parents' anniversary and they greeted us with a glass of champagne to celebrate. We decided to have the seasonal tasting menu with wine pairing and every dish tasted great. My mother was hesitant about the tasting menu as she did not want a duck dish, but they were extremely accommodating and let her choose another dish to replace that with. The complexity of flavors, textures and presentation and the impeccable service is why I give Gramercy 5+ stars. In addition, the culinary team presents surprise dishes throughout the meal-- we received a parsnip puree, apple sorbet, homemade chocolate/gummies and a to-go granola bar. These surprises go above and beyond and that is what you are paying for. My family and I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant on our next trip to NYC!

This classic NYC venue is fantastic. I went with my 83 yr old parents and the staff was so kind and patient. One of the staff walked my dad to the bathroom. When my dad wasn't too happy with his steak tartar being spiced up, the same woman took it back and the chef sent him another no spiced portion. This place is the episode of class. Worth every penny!
This is one of my favorite restaurants. The service is amazing. The staff is knowledgeable and attentive. You can come for formal dining or a casual meal between NYC sightseeing.

First time back since quarantine. Was great to be back. That said, they have kept prices on the menu relatively the same as pre-quarantine but was told they are not including tip in the menu price anymore at the end of the meal. would have appreciated that communicated upfront. Please understand was well worth the price regardless, but felt a bit icky to find out (as a long time client) at the end.
I came here in May 2016 with my family to celebrate my graduation. Now in 2019, I can still remember what a wonderful time I had here. Will definitely come back.

Overheard: "My name isn't as effective as it was before 2016 so I was not able to procure a table last time I was in NYC. Danny Meyer, just like your establishment did to my plans to spend a night with my Choate chums talking nonstop about my initiatives for women's empowerment in D.C., I give you a rating of 'Ah. Okay.'" - Ivanka Trump
Granmercy is a beautiful establishment. Can be great to gather with friends or go on a romantic outing with your loved one. Great food and even better service.

Had a wonderful experience here for lunch. Right in the Gramercy area, The restaurant is beautiful, the service is attentive and quick but not intrusive. The wine was great, as was my salad and the delicious bread and butter (seriously never tasted butter that delicious in my life). Make a reservation, dress well, and enjoy!
Amazing place that knows how to take care of regulars! Love everything from food to cocktails to vibe!

We had dinner here for our 8 year anniversary back in February. The food was great, but the service was truly exceptional. The attention to detail was beyond and they made it a very special dinner for us.
What a dining experience. The food and the ambience are quite elegant t without being too pretentious. I am very much looking forward to going back.

I was in love with the cocktails here and not to mention their menu.. I loved the roasted oysters! The food was presented nicely with the kale and everything. I also tried the duck meatballs which were crispy and delicious! The vibe in the tavern was great. The bar staff was very attentive and socials as well. I enjoyed the dishes and will be back to try more on the menu.

My fiance and I came to Gramercy Tavern while we were in New York for the weekend. We had gotten engaged earlier that day and had reservations for the pre-fix menu at night. From the time we got there, the staff at Gramercy Tavern made sure that we felt special and taken care of. Our server offered to take photos of us, brought out complimentary wine, and even a chocolate cake at the end! Not to mention she was personable, knowledgeable about the menu, and repeatedly checked in with us to make sure that we were enjoying our meal. Each course that was brought out was more delicious than the last. While this restaurant is expensive, it is worth it. The staff at Gramercy Tavern went above and beyond to make the night of our engagement perfect!

Darling restaurant and impeccable service! Love the bar area. The main dining area is very intimate and cozy. The six course seasonal menu was tasty and beautifully presented. But portions were very small. Even after a couple delicious brioche between the courses, my wife and I were still hungry at the end of the six courses meal.  Good place for a date, as long as you don't come in starving...
Great place for dinner or lunch and has a great historical feel. Great food and service plus location is great.

We came here for a night of celebration and tried their seasonal tasting menu which features 6 courses. Food was solid, but nothing too special, I'd give it a 7/10, portions were pretty large in our opinion, we started feeling full after the 3rd course. service was really good considering this is a no-tipping restaurant. Our server was very tentative, and caring, and it's just nice to know that he wasn't doing it for the $$. Overall a decent experience, I would say $200 for a one star tasting menu was a tiny bit overpriced, considering it didn't really wow us, but I would still recommend, very decent experience.

I love gramercy tavern! Came for Saturday brunch for my birthday, and loved every second of it.  Amazing service by Carolyn and Juan - really made my mom and I feel special.  Had the tasting menu.  Favorite course was definitely the mushroom tortellini, and treat chocolate cake!  Best chocolate cake I've ever had - so moist and delicious.  Can't wait to come back!

Such an amazing and memorable meal. The service rivals any I have ever had, and the food was incredible. The fall cocktail was also delicious, as was the bread and butter (could literally melt away in that), and the complimentary extras (truffles, appetizer). I had the pappardelle, lamb loin, and red wine pears for dessert (with Stilton ice cream that was to die for). Overall incredible impressed with my experience - this will definitely be my go-to fancy / celebration restaurant from now on.

Everything about this dining experience was exquisite, from the perfectly cooked meat, to the fresh salads, to the out-of-this-world sides, to the scrumptious dessert. My wife and my in-laws couldn't stop raving about this place before we went, and now I see why. It's top-notch, and one of the best places I've gone in NYC. The service was five-stars as well. I'll be back, and the next time, I'll take clients.

Unparalled dinning experience. Considered as one of the best restaurants in NYC, Gramercy Tavern definitely give off a pretty cozy vibe. The interior is decorated with beautiful seasonal flowers. We had cocktails at the bar and then seasonal tasting menu with wine pairing at the table. The food, desserts, and drinks were on point and beautifully presented. The service was impeccable, definitely an all-around class act. Will be back.
The food is just top-notch. I'll tell you what, it's been a long time since I've felt such hearty hospitality and tasty food.

The four of us got the tasting menu for lunch. Signature $89 and Vegetable $79 tasting menus were amazing! First time here, only heard about its greatness, but expectations were exceeded. I feel like I had 5 entrees and 3 desserts, all sized to satisfaction. Quality and taste were exceptional. Must do if you're in Manhattan.
The truffle burger is worth the trip. A consistent restaurant with really attentive service and solid food

Everything was perfect. Especially the service. Benjamin is a pro and helped us to navigate the menu and make great selections. The wagyu meatballs were a favorite for us. The flatbread was awesome and the liver mousse was silky delicious. Drinks were excellent and the bartenders very friendly when we stopped for after dinner drinks.
Wagyu beef sandwich was pretty decent. Came here for a weekend lunch, sat in the main dining room. Good service!

Stellar as always. Celebrating a special friend's birthday who has a busy schedule. They worked with me to plan a very special evening even though they were fully booked. Victor is a lovely person who is so respectful of your requests ... he is divine. And of course the food is impeccable and delicious. The house made kombucha is swoon-worthy. It is the meal of dreams ... with a candle that makes your every wish come true.

Had such a great experience and met with so many prominent people at gramercy which was unexpected. The best part was when the executive sous chef John karis poured me a glass of water when our server was too busy to check on our table. It was definitely a busy Friday night so it was awesome to get the kind of service we got from the higher ups of the restaurant.

Finally, I came here to dine with family on a Friday summer evening in The Tavern (walk-ins only). At 6 pm, it was pretty busy and service was very good. The starter bread was phenomenal that I had to ask for just one more piece. We split the dishes and got the grilled tuna, duck, and wagyu meatballs. In the beginning, I thought the portions looked small but I ended up being very full. We were so stuffed that by the time dessert rolled around, we shared the ricotta donuts with jam -- they were simply divine. Totally recommend a visit at least once.

Second time there and the food was amazing. Got a table in bar area. Every course was better then the last! The service from the maître d' to our waiter and everyone in between was beyond perfect. We didn't feel pressure leave or hurry through any course. Cant wait to go back!

My husband booked a prefixed dinner for our anniversary a month in advance and talked to them about my shellfish allergy and no raw meat diet restriction due to my pregnancy. They said no problem and will accommodate. When we arrived, the waiter literally told me I can't have the first course as it is a semi raw fish and  they are not going to cook it well done, so I should just have a cold carrot soup instead. Then the second course is a lobster!!! They will just simply remove it from the menu for me, but I can have some really nice garbanzo beans (the garnish) instead. Are you kidding me??? Do you think I'm just some stupid rich dumb face who would just pay whatever for whatever bullshit you are selling? I said oh well it's not going to work out for me and the waiter kept pushing it on me, "I think it's very nice, it has a nice flow, first have some cold soup, then eat some nice beans (then pay 500 dollars and get out here). You guys ruined my anniversary.
Never was a fan of this place.  Overpriced and tasteless food.  I guess being a famous chef gives you the right to charge more and give less!!

Sooo delicious! Benny was absolutely amazing and made the best drinks! The staff was super friendly. We had the Brussels sprout salad and fluke and it was so delicious! We finished the night off with another round and some dessert which was so tasty! Will definitely return!

Beautiful and cozy bar/restaurant with amazing floral arrangements. The menu is concise and informative. I chose the seasonal squash salad which was breathtaking. My sausage entree was like no other. The Sazarac Rye whisky was perfectly mixed. Love this place
One star for the server, one star for my company. The food was disappointing. We went for the seasonal tasting menu. The fish was bland, the duck was hard to chew..

My fantastic wife and I had lunch here today and it was delishOriffic! My burger was superb, a huge steaky beef patty cooked to a perfect medium and smothered with cheese and crunchy bacon. My wife's Seabass was also excellent, served on a bed of thin sliced leaks and potatoes with a heavenly rich creamy broth. We had an apetizer of the zucchini flatbread which was tasty and quite extra garlicky. I had their "little bird" cocktail, a mix of Appleton reserve rum, lime juice, falernum and proseco. I also asked for a mai tai made with Diplomatica reserva (one of our favorite rums), it was superb, mixed with their house made orgeat. Service was spectacular also. Definitely glad we stopped in for lunch!

Honestly I can tell you that I am not hip to eating raw fish, but this Tuna Tartare has completely my perspective. As soon as this meal reached my tastebuds, there was no stopping me. Absolutely EVERYTHING in and about this dish was superb.

Wow - literally wow!  Best meal and dining experience I've had to date, this group really stepped it up and delivered for our anniversary dinner.  All food lovers should dine here at least once in their lives.  Great job GT team, and thank you for the experience!
This place is elegant. The staff waits on you very well and the food is prepared with excellence. I recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a romantic spot or a quiet place to eat.

One of NYC best - full stop. Great food, great service, great ambiance, great location. Finally got around to having the burger - as good as promised. Kicked things off with a greenmarket Tomato and Stone Fruit Salad- peak season goodness. Go. Just go.

Upon my "annual" trip to NYC, I had to make a point of going back to Gramercy Tavern to specifically eat in the Tavern, not the dining room, though the dining room menu is top notch.  I really went for the cheeseburger, which is not typically listed on any of their menus.  The cheeseburger was delicious, one of the best that I've had, and packed with good classic meat and cheese flavor.
Had an incredible dinner here! Servers were very knowledgable as well as super sweet. Thank you for helping us celebrate!

We came here for a special occasion, and despite all the hype, we were unfortunately disappointed. The service was mediocre, inattentive and slow. The atmosphere was stuffy. The food was good, but nothing spectacular. Our mains were lukewarm and didn't seem freshly prepared. Did we just come on an off night? For GT and my sake, i wish it were a better dining experience.
Great food as always!  Service was wonderful. Price drinks are still way high. Especially for a local can of Brooklyn Brewery beer.

Lunch at this long established Manhattan favorite was delicious. The atmosphere in this great restaurant is fabulous whether dining at a table or at the bar. Well staffed with a terrific bartender and amazing drinks, we had a lovely time!

My wife and I had the Seasonal Tasting Menu + wine pairings for a late lunch back in January 2018.  Really enjoyed the food and ambience -- although the wine pairings were just average or what one would expect.  Maybe it's a bit unfair to compare the wine pairings after eating at Eleven Madison Park the night before.  With that said, we're looking forward to revisiting Gramercy Tavern the next time we're in NYC.
I do love this place. Good food and great service. Food is always fresh and special. Great cocktails too.

One of my favorite restaurants on the island, the entire floor is decorated beautifully and by season. Past the entrance is the bar area with lots of individual tables for small groups, and then the formal dining area for groups who wish for a more intimate meal. Part of the kitchen is open, with the grill blazing, and the remaining kitchen is closed off. They dabble with creative options but also make available staples such as their amazing burger. Everything is done well. The food is delicious. The drinks strong and tasty. The staff super professional, friendly and knowledgable. Sous chef Chris (I think that was his name) personally came by with our main meal, which we ordered based on his recommendation. This is a must every time.

There is a LIVE BUG found in my food!!!!!! And I am half way done of that dishes. Vomit right away! Only took that dish off my bill. There is a potential health issue which is more that that 25 dollars!!! Photo for evidence! I will also report to health department!! Unforgivable for restaurant like this.

Four stars because the lamb was not as good as we expected. However, the flatbread was VERY GOOD, must try. Also, the burger was amazing too. The drinks were over priced. Overall, it was good place to dine. Good customer service and food was good.

This is one of my favorite spots in the City. The ambiance truly makes this place special. The service and wait staff are always incredible and the food is always delicious. Pretty pricey but well worth it. I definitely recommend this place for a special occasion.

We came here for our 1 year wedding anniversary. We ordered the seasonal prefix and the vegetarian prefix as well. Both were surprisingly scrumptious and delicious. Super Fresh ingredients that are cooked very well to perfection. Very impressed about the vegetarian prefix the flavors were superb and complex at the same time.
This place is a must do in NYC for dinner. Make reservations and sit in the dining room. Great service and food. Loved the rice pudding dessert!
Went to Gramercy tavern for celebrating our anniversary on 29th Feb... Great food and service... Everything was top notch.

Spectacular Meal!   Service was friendly and helpful.  Our server Amy helped explain the options.   We opted for the three course dinner and were allowed to supplment with a modest upcharge.   We started with the scallops which are lightly marinated and the lobster chowder from the Spring Menu.  Then we moved to the steak tartare which was the best I have ever eaten along with the avocado brussel sprouts salad that was innovative and delicious.  For entrees we had the pork which was really unusual and beautifully plated and the sea bass.  And we finished with the cookie plate that had a huge assortement of the best cookies you can find on the planet.   I had two glasses of wine which the very patient Som helped pair with my different courses.   Without a doubt the best Restaurant in NYC!

This is one of the best places I have been to and eaten at. It is more of an experience than a dinner. And Aiysha was our waitress - and her knowledge and service was not just A+, but was the best I have ever seen!

We had a lovely dinner here for our 15th anniversary. Made the reservations online. As the time got closer, they emailed me to confirm and also asked how long we had been married, any food allergies, etc. The hosts up front we're very friendly. We had to wait about 10 minutes for our table. Our server was so friendly and engaging. All the other servers who helped clear the table and bring new plates were also efficient and welcoming. They have their service well-choreographed! They started us with complimentary glasses of champagne. The amuse-bouche was awesome - we wanted more! We opted for the three course dinner which was just perfect in size after the complimentary rolls, amuse-bouche and complimentary after dinner truffles. The coconut cake and homemade granola bars were also welcome extras that topped off a lovely meal.

Food is excellent but the service is also spectacular. We went for the a la carte menu, but they let you choose dishes from the tasting menu as well, so I got the carrot salad from the vegetarian tasting menu and it was one of the best salads I've had at restaurants like these. The burger was great as well but a little heavy. The strawberries & cream were great but the coconut meringue was to die for, and I'd come back to GT just for that.

This is one of the places my boyfriend took me to when I visited New York for the first time. This is, hands down, one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. It's a beautifully decorated place, and it reminded a lot of restaurants in London. There are two sections: one that is more affordable and all the way to the back is the other more fancy section. We did the pre-fixed menu in the latter (I ordered the sampler).  It's quite pricey - I think our dinner was almost $400.00, including tips. Pretty cool they give you complimentary dessert and homemade bars to take home afterwards! My only complaint is the customer service - most of the servers were great, but others were not as friendly (but maybe it's just New York).

It wasn't a bad experience but it wasn't that impressive either. Bread wasn't warm when served to us. Calamari Flat bread was just ok. And among the main courses, I would say that the Sunchoke Ravioli beats the Lamb T bone and the Monkfish. The intervals of wait from sitting you, to taking the orders and serving appetizers to the main course, were so long to their own detriment since there were parties of three, or two that could have been seated if food came in faster than half an hour. Service was very polite and even friendly. Wait staff is very well trained. The ambience is worth coming for though. We were at the Tavern and it was definitely livelier than the Dining Room which seemed austere. I would definitely go back if the meals were more memorable, but the only thing memorable was the chocolate pudding cake with coconut ice cream.

Its nice to be able to get top notch food and drinks in the city without having to get all dressed up. We got the tasting menu and the food and service were both great. Every course was spot on. The staff is great at explaining what everything is and were very accommodating with requested substitutions.

This is a NY institution for good reason.  We were able to get in without any trouble on a weekday before noon for a table of 2, as the place was just opening for lunch.  The tavern area with about 15 tables up front is quite warm and inviting and casual, much less stuffy than the formal white tablecloth covered tables towards the back of the restaurant.  The wine selection's solid, and I was quite happy with my heirloom tomato soup-sandwich combo, which was delicious, yet light enough for a lunch meal.  The soup was similar to an Andalucian gazpacho, so blended together fresh heirloom tomatoes and olive oil with light salt and spices, with chunks of cucumber.  The sandwich was on a lovely focaccia, with a spicy remoulade of sorts generously slathered on, along with slices of green tomato, bacon, and lettuce.  The complimentary cheddar jalapeno focaccia was also a real treat.  I'll definitely be back.

This is a gem and a classic of NYC. There is no way you can fail here. They will always be outstanding on service, food and taking care of everything. For my spouse and I this is our favorite restaurant for special occasions. Expensive but worth it!

I've been to Gramercy twice. I did the tasting menu the first time (definitely the way to go). My favorite items from there were the shaved ice dessert at the end of the tasting menu and the pasta dish. Get the tasting menu if you go, the quality is amazing!

We ordered their Restaurant Week special of Minestrone Soup,  Mushroom Lasagna and a chocolate chunk cookie.  Based on their reputation we were excited  to experience their food.  The soup tasted as if it came directly from a can.  The lasagna had absolutely no flavor whatsoever.  The cookie was good but nothing out of the ordinary.  Very disappointing and even at the restaurant week value it was not acceptable.

Delicious food - great service - not stuffy like some of the other spots we went to. The kitchen gave us three portions of a few items on the seasonal set as us three girls wanted to share the set lunch and ordered extra appies and entrées. Loved the service and the food!

(Really 3.5 stars) Had the 6 course tasting menu. All of the food was at least good, some of it great, and one or two of the dishes were outstanding. All in, though, it was somehow still not a very memorable meal. And while portion sizes are supposed to be on the smaller end for a coursed menu set, some of the dishes were offensively small. The "lobster" was served as three mini--I kid you not--dime-sized medallions, though in a reasonably tasty sauce. And the savory finale was a slice of (while perfectly done) steak that could not have been more than 1.5 oz. Maybe we can chalk my experience up to the psychology of outsized expectations. Perhaps, sometimes, it doesn't pay to have your reputation precede you.

You can either enjoy an a la cart menu in the tavern or a tasting menu in the main dining room. I recommend coming in for lunch and sitting in the tavern at the bar and getting the delicious burger! One of my favorite burgers in NYC! If you are celebrating or want to treat yourself then sit in the dining room and experience the full tasting menu! The service is amazing! Also hospitality is included!

Had a lovely early dinner on the Tavern side (more casual area in front; the dining room is by courses). Started with divine Joanna Rabbit whiskey cocktail. Baked lumache for entree (cheesy and delicious), sides of amazing things they did with cucumbers and golden beets.  Fantastic, friendly service. Lovely ambiance.

As you can probably guess, the food here is pretty wonderful. You can tell everything is designed with such care. I also appreciate that they have a vegetarian tasting menu. It's also beautifully decorated. Just be prepared for a very long meal if you are choosing the tasting menu - it's worth it, but you need to allot three hours or more.

Did the tasting menu for lunch. Food was a bit disappointing but not bad. Out of about 5 courses 2 or 3 were really enjoyable with the rest just moving the session along. Ambience was simple yet elegant.

We ordered the seasonal tasting menu and it is $89 for each and non tipping! I love the bread and asked for one more. I also love the salmon and the caramel pear! I would come again. The environment and service is also great!

Gramercy is a gem for many occasions, truly any. We wrapped up a birthday dinner here, one of many visits, with custom cake and single malt. Good bless, and hope corporate entities won't plan to take away what makes this place unique and supreme.

Nice ambiance. TERRIBLE DRINKS.  My boyfriend and I went for a cocktail after dinner. I've heard rave reviews about this place being a must. I will never be back $70 for 3 drinks that tasted like a dirty glass. I wanted to puke. Very disappointed. Save you money for literally any other bar.

The restaurant is beautiful overall and the service is amazing, but I just didn't love the food. I ate here a couple of months ago and the main thing I remember is the Arctic char because it was almost raw inside and I didn't enjoy it. The rock shrimp was very good. I remember the desserts as just being ok. There are plenty of expensive restaurants in the city that I would like to try before coming back here.

We had a great dinner here during Thanksgiving weekend. Wait was two hours for bar at 4:30 pm but they squeezed us in to dining room much sooner. Burger, Wagy Meatballs, a wonderful salad and Chocolate Pudding Cake- a perfect meal and perfect service.

Came here for the second time because the food is so good. Went for the lunch chefs tasting menu and it was probably the best meal I've ever had. Almost everything is amazing there. There was some sort of complimentary beet sorbet with goat cheese that was not good... but everything else was so divine. We asked to substitute the pear desert for the goats milk cheese cake (I had this last time and started crying it was so good) and it was amazing! The staff is so nice and professional, they really make you feel special. It was my boyfriends and I third year anniversary and they gave us complimentary champagne and a free desert. The tasting menu for lunch was amazing and I'd totally recommend  it!

I am so sad that I have to give my all time favorite restaurant 3 stars.  I really do not understand why when you have a great thing you change it.   I absolutely loved this place!  I have been here at least 20x & every time I thoroughly enjoyed it.   This time was different.  It just wasn't that great & certainly not the same as it once was.  The prices were astronomical and the meal was average.  The tasting menu was superb & now it's hardly memorable.  The only saving grace of the night was the waiter was friendly and the waitstaff was nice.  Surprising as they don't work on tips.
Nice high class meal that amuses your tastebuds. Each dish was nicely presented with intriguing flavors.  Some were a little odd but overall very pleased. Staff very attentive. Would return.

It was amazing experience for me and my boyfriend. Was beyond my expectations.. our server tony was very friendly and attentive as well as our busser / runner Tyler who was super friendly and professional. I am super impressed by our sommelier Alvaro , who was very informative and had a excellent knowledge about wine and very  comforting hospitality. food was delicious and favourful with wonderful plating

The worst food I think I've ever had. I have never felt so guilty about spending $180+ dollars on food for ONE person before. I don't mind spending a lot of money on food when it's good, but this was extremely disappointing! The place was really nice & the mood was set nice. We were seated and got water brought to us & then we waited for what felt like forever to get our server. Finally we got drinks & I had the MOST awful drink off of their menu. I don't know why anyone would create such a drink. After one sip I told the server I hated it & asked if I could exchange it for a different drink. He looked at me kind of weird and said sure. He brought me my different drink which tasted SO off but was drinkable. Their homemade bread was very very good ! That was the best part sadly. The 3 courses were absolutely awful. One of the dishes I had was pasta with ground beef & honestly hamburger helper tastes better ! Such a lack of flavor ! My main course the meat was so tough & chewy I couldn't even get it down ! Their baklava IS NOT BAKLAVA ! Not one thing about it resembles a baklava !!! That wasn't even a fancy version of it , it straight up was something else and they put the name on it. Whoever added that to the menu has never seen a baklava in their life ! I don't know how this place had anything more than 1 star and how people actually like this food. I think it's so "high end" that people just agree to say it's good. This place is terrible please DO NOT waste your money on it !!!! Me + 3 other girls all agree that was awful overly priced food & cannot express how disappointed we were ! Awful awful awful !!!!!!

Came here to dine at the Tavern bar so we could specifically have their famous burger. It was worth all the hype and more. The burger was incredibly juicy and cooked perfectly. The bun looked like it would be really dry but it had just the right amount of squeeze and moisture. The sauce they serve with the burger stole the show. It had a great acidity and savoriness to it which paired great with the fatty burger. In previous reviews people said the burger was huge and to share which I did with my husband but it wasn't too large at all and we probably could have each had one easily. The ginger swizzle mocktail was divine! Our $17 apple salad was tasty but nothing to rave about and overpriced for the 4 bites small portion, which is expected from a fine dining establishment.

Lived up to its high rating.  Beet salad was excellent, lamb was one of the best cuts I've ever had, and the sauce was unique and delicious. Service was outstanding - listened carefully to my dietary restrictions and found great combos.

Funny postscript to this review. Management has arranged 4 calls with me. Never once have they called and actually listened to my complaints.  They simply don't care.  It's a name and reputation and am embarrassing testament to everything wrong in the hospitality and restaurant industry.  $200-400 for horrible service, ridiculously bad attitude and a staff that doesn't care.  The steak was served ice cold too!

Worth for what you paying $$$$ ! food , wine and dessert and plus great service from the front door when you walked into restaurant. I have tried both front room and back dining room. They both was great experiences. Service very professional and friendly

Spangetini app was primo as was the tomato and mozzarella. My lamb / sausage.. hummmm good but, Not crazy over it as lamb & Italian sausage guy.. my guest did not finish swordfish nor did my other guest go crazy over the chicken dish. We did enjoy a 120.00 bottle of wine but still not feeling the value after 320.00 lunch. PS.. loved the cookies at the end overall I give it a 2.9-3 rating... The tavern menu looks better .. I saw a great pannini walking into dining room , should have gotten that but that's not served in dining room at lunch. Not going back.. I am a new Yorker.
Amazing food, amazing service. The chicken entree is to die for. Cant believe Ive lived in nyc for 12 years and I hadnt been here before. Would come back in a heartbeat!
Benny behind the bar is pure class.  He was attentive and accommodating and made us feel welcome on a busy Saturday evening.

This was a wonderful dining experience for our last night in NYC. We ordered the seasonal tasting menu with wine pairing. Each dish was crafted with the wine in the forefront. My favorite dish was sea bream with a lovely butter sauce finished with pumpkin seeds.  We also had a wonderful scallop ceviche with white balsamic vinagre and cilantro oil. This dish began the tasting menu and was Also spectacular. To accompany the wonderful food we had amazing service. Hands down a great experience for our anniversary dinner.

This place is hands down one of the best restaurants in NYC.  Despite all of the amazing food options in the city, I just keep finding myself coming back here.  Whether you are in the bar or the main dinning room, the food and cocktails never disappoint.  The staff is always delightful and does their best to accommodate you even if you don't have a reservation.  It's not inexpensive by any means, but definitely worth every dollar!

It was simply perfect. Our waiter, Greg, was excellent. He was eloquent and very polite and attentive. Our food was delicious. When they realized that my guest and I were simplifying an appetizer, they brought it in two separate plates. Because I couldn't finish my cocktail, they didn't even include it in the check. I got the lamb for entree and it was very yummy. The desserts were spectacular. I cannot wait to go again!

Busy and sometimes noisy. Managed to see celebrity while dining. We sat at the bar and both had the Tavern Burger which was fantastic. Wine selection was also a bit limited (no New Zealand Sauvignon Blancs for instance). The ambiance was conducive to a very lovely time enjoying our wines and meals.

What an exceptional dining experience. Each dish was a well balanced example of culinary magnificence. Each server knowledgeable and eager to please. The experience was only amplified by the gracious general manager. Thanks so much!  We will be back.

We just had a private lunch here for my brothers graduation and it was amazing! Darlene and Angela were super on top of the whole process and I felt like we were well taken care of. They are very very responsive and were extremely accommodating for all requests, allergies, and last minute changes. Over all a very memorable experience!

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: This is probably my favorite restaurant in New york ! Everything is good. Especially all staff are very kind.   I'm looking forward to next time.

Dinner at Gramercy Tavern was spectacular, and truly lived up to its reputation. The crab salad, artic char and rhubarb-berry dessert were really memorable, all fresh, bright, bold. Service was impeccable and the decor is so lovely. A must do at least once in NY.

It's hard to get a five star rating - as most people don't think any place can live up to the 'hype'.  This place is it.  Expensive - and worth every penny.  Service, ambiance and dining experience are incredible.  Wish there was a little more room to wait for your table in the bar - but who cares when your meal is that good?  Attention to detail was amazing - as was our three course meal.  Make main dining room reservation 28 days in advance - and then anxiously wait for this experience!

Just went here for my birthday and was treated like a queen. Are the most excellent fare - the kale apple cheddar salad was to die for! I want to go back immediately and probably will the next time I am in NYC. What I particularly loved was their selection of non-alcoholic drinks! What a classy joint. I will tell everyone to come here if they get a chance.

Oyster raw and cooked to perfect.. peppers were average but the accompanying sauce was dangerously good... the burger was cooked to perfection and the chocolate pudding is what I want to be incorporated into my last meal!
Went there with my wife and daughter on a Friday night. It was crowded but service was incredible.  I had the meatball dish which was so tender and flavorful!

Gramercy nails it every time. Appetizers, entrees, and desserts are all perfect. The little bread rolls and goat cheese butter were to die for. The price and portions are fair for what you are getting (for a "fancy" restaurant, I never leave hungry and the prices are reasonably affordable). The menu is seasonal and changes regularly. Service is always spot on. This is hands down my favorite all around restaurant in NYC.
Worth the wait! The food was extraordinary and each plate was distinct with complicated flavors. I remember especially the tomato and watermelon salad that was salted exactly right.

This place was excellent. I sat at the bar for some wine and got the best service I would have asked for. The bartender Ben allowed me to try as many types of wine as I wanted until I found the right one. The place is really pretty and had also a great selection of cocktails. It does get busy and even to sit at the bar you will have to wait in line for a few minutes!
Walked in for lunch was seated right away. Server and food was very good. Great cocktails.

We had a fantastic tasting menu lunch at Gramercy Tavern on a Saturday. As expected, the food and service were simply exquisite. We started with a fresh and nicely marinated crudo, and followed with a halibut course, squid ink pasta with lobster, roasted duck breast, and a sorbet with meringue. While the restaurant was fairly empty when we arrived, it quickly filled up. When paying the check, we were pleasantly surprised with a few bonbons as a parting treat. Overall a lovely lunch experience. In addition to the lunch tasting menu, Gramercy Tavern offers a $32 "The Daily" set menu of three courses, as well as a la carte options.
While I have yet to try the public seating area, our experience in the private room was fantastic pre covid. The lamb and duck were superb! Highly recommend for your next fancy get together.

We were able to order the amazing lobster salad off the tasting menu while still sticking to the more manageable two course meal. I went with the black bass for my main, boneless, simple, tasty. The chocolate cake with hazelnuts provided a decadent finish. Definitely have some work to do in the gym when I get back to SF. Service was well coordinated and unobtrusive. Great meal!
Nice staff and great food. Come here after work just to kick back and even with outdoor seating, it's got a great atmosphere.

One of the classics that still delivers! Had a wonderful dinner - the strawberries & cream, the pork pasta & the crudo were the highlights. They were so accommodating to my friend who is celiac, egg & dairy free. Wine pairings were perfect! Wish there was one more red wine and that dishes were a little hotter. Looking forward to visiting the tavern one day soon!
Best overall experience and its an institution for a reason. They are consistently great in all respects.

Great food, love the seasonal combinations. You can totally taste the amount of effort the chef puts in each dish it tasted divine. The customer service was fantastic. We chose the lamb ravioli and the pork loin and belly. The pork belly was perfectly crisp and the lamb ravioli was complimented well with the sauce and leafy greens. We left the restaurant completely satisfied. Definitely will go again, we definitely had an experience to remember.

Other restaurants take note, this is how you serve people especially during a pandemic. It's actually better service than normal lol the new staff is great very attentive and friendly the only thing is the menu does not have as many options as before, but still tasty and great  wine list.

I dropped by to grab a drink here. Roger Fritz Spritz was really cool, refreshing yet not too strong. I was impressed by the great service. I could say the lighting and decor inside the place were terrific, facilitating photo shooting :)

One of the best restaurants in Manhattan.  Wanted to go for so long and just kept putting it off.  Sorry  we did.   Absolutely fantastic.   I will give it one and ONLY one negative.   They are doing construction right in front and since my husband has a leg problem.  Not good.   But lets forget that because construction or not we will be back.   Food.  Clean, fresh , delicious.    Waiters and staff.   Couldn't be more helpful.    Enjoyed our anniversary

Just amazing. Every. Single. Time. As good as it was over 20 years ago, when I first walked in. The food is amazing-- but what really makes this place special is the service. It feels like you are the only one in the room. Family. Home.

This was just perfect in every way. You walk in to a welcoming room and are warmly greeted. They gently escort you through this flower and art filled space and to your table. The surroundings are exquisite. Add to this perfectly fresh ingredients cooked to perfection. Beautiful presentation. Service almost anticipated my needs before I realized them. A classic.
We tried the tasting menu and each course was delicious. I find the cuisine to be quite simple but very flavorful. The wine paring was amazing!

Gramercy Tavern hasn't missed a beat even on The Street!  We found The Street menu excellent.  The Chicken Liver Mousse was very light and did not have a strong liver pate taste.  It went perfectly with the Grilled Pepper Chicken--really big pieces of chicken--and Cioppino.  Ending with the Caffe Panna Gelato--that was so good we ordered an extra Gelato!   The Servers were wonderful in making us feel relaxed and "they got this down."   We appreciate GT's efforts in making the experience of eating outside fun and romantic.  And, goes without saying--EXCELLENT food and service as always!!

I will start off by saying that I am a huge fan of Danny Meyer and have been to pretty much all of his jaunts.  Gramercy Tavern is clearly the classic, my Flatiron fav that never fails to "wow."  The ambiance is beautiful and flower-filled; service is superlative. I typically will only consider the main room for major celebrations, given the expense.  But the front tavern also offers fabulous a la carte offerings at a somewhat more affordable price -- making Gramercy Tavern a realistic option not just for birthdays and anniversaries.

We popped into Gramercy Tavern on a weekday in the early afternoon, not wildly hungry but seeking a nosh. After ordering drinks - Portside Spritz for me, Gramercy Garden for him - we ordered the three vegetable sides as the strength of the accompaniments show the authentic character of the restaurant. Leeks with a smoky flavor and delicate cheese grated atop, butter beans braised in a number of herbs, and cucumbers with a yoghurt sauce (akin to a deconstructed tzatziki) all shined.

Recently had a business dinner in a private room at the Gramercy Tavern.  We started with hors d'oeuvres which were varied and good (especially the tomato tartelette.)  Whoever had selected the wine did an excellent job.  I stuck to white wine and first enjoyed a very good white Bordeaux and then a white Burgundy (Meursault.)  The dinner itself was very good.  I selected a tomato salad with burrata cheese as starter, then followed with an excellent bar; and finished with fresh fruit.  I will return here.

Not for the faint of heart, I love to visit this restaurant and feel like Chef Anthony is always updating the menu. Lots of options, great wine selection, and lots of bustle. If you find yourself in the vicinity of Park and 23rd. Check it out.
Great food. Great service. Order cheesecake for dessert. Warm lobster salad for appetizer.

This is an experience! Instagram upperfeast. The space is beautiful and the ambiance rules. They have a huge staff and they're all very friendly. It's fancy but not stuffy or pretentious. PRO TIP order the tasting menu and vegetarian menu and share. It's worth it and kind of a hack to try way more things. I love Gramercy Tavern.

Our first time in NYC.  I wanted to treat my wife and Gramercy did not disappointed. We both had the seasonal menu and it was 5 courses.  Needless to say we cleaned our plates. Be warned, they serve it on big plates but small bite offerings.  The experience from entry to leaving was top notch.  We don't do this often but this was an opportunity we couldn't miss.  Thank you Gramercy Tavern for a beautiful dinner and  unforgettable trip.

Fantastic place.  Staff + Service are amazing, every  produce is sourced carefully making the food as delightful as can be. The bar area has seating and its own menu so you don't have to spend $300/person each visit (but if you are celebrating something, do have the experience at their main dining room, it's exquisite) this may be the best kept secret burger in town & the wine selection is fabulous... can't go wrong with going here.

Service is excellent, the waiter that served us and the receptionist lady was great! Food is not as good as I thought. It's a bit loud for a high class restaurant. It's a very popular restaurant. Our reservation was at 5:15pm, finished tasting menu at 8ish. We got a free cake because that was my friend's birthday. I'd recommend people to go try still.

One of my first stops when visiting the city is Gramercy Tavern.  It never disappoints!  A seat at the bar is one of my favorites when dining solo.  Gramercy was "Farm to Table," before it was so popular.  Always on my "must dine" list!

No Complaints, this place is perfect. I visited the dining room on a Saturday evening with reservations. I did the tasting menu which was very diverse, tons of creative flavours and colours. The wine list is great, service amazing, ambience awesome, flowers EVERYWHERE (which I love) and most importantly delicious. Portions were not laughably small so I was actually stuffed by the end. I will say the dessert was the largest portion which was weird. The tavern is walk-in only so the wait can be quite long (2 hours +) but if you want the certainty, try and get reservations in the dining room for a less stressful experience.

Came to celebrate my moms birthday. Great food and ambience. Service was just the right amount - very attentive but not overwhelming. Us three all got the seasonal tasting menu and mom added wine pairing. There were a couple highlights among the 6 courses and overall the food was very fresh. The only accident was that There was some thread thingy in my beef dish. They apologized and admitted this shouldn't have happened whatsoever and took it off from the check. Oh, they also nicely accommodated our 9 months old, so if you have babies/kids and don't want to deal with the potential embarrassment at other high end restaurants, this is the place to be.

I went to gramercy last Thursday for a class project. During my entire service, all the waiters were attentive to any questions i had and the food did not take long to arrive. The price for lunch was very understandable (I had a 3 course meal that was priced around $60). Overall, I would go back just for the experience once more.

Absolutely my go-to spot whenever I'm in NYC! Friendly staff and amazing food, consistent perfection just as I remembered since first visit . Can't really describe all the details in one short review, but those little details they put into customer service and food is worth a million.
I don't understand why Gramercy Tavern is so popular. Food was just okay and nothing special but expensive. I don't recommend this place!

So good!! Went here for a nice dinner with my dad without a reservation and ate on the tavern side. That being said, was not disappointed at all. It was amazing with 100% the same quality service and food as the dining room.

My wife and I visited Gramercy Tavern and we absolutely loved it. The food, atmosphere, and service were fantastic. We had been here once before in the Tavern but this was our first time eating in the Dining Room. We both ordered the seasonal tasting menu and were very happy with our choice. We tried foods that we wouldn't have tried before and we were served food that we normally don't enjoy. Each dish was better than the next. Our favorite was the duck breast and the tortellini - both were perfect. Everyone should experience this wonderful restaurant.

Had the 3 course meal. What astounded me was the balanced portions to make you full while delivering optimum flavor, awesome service from all staff (greeted every time you walk by), and magnificent take on dessert. I had cookies and ice cream for dessert which turned out to be the most magnificent 5 start quality cookie I've ever had. Great place for a fancy date night or celebration with trust that your food will be the best from appetizer to dessert

Came to Gramercy Tavern during my first year as a NYC resident and it was totally worth the hype. From the interior decor and impeccable service to the perfectly portioned plates of the most fresh and seasonal ingredients, there's probably no other lunch that I can have in my life that will ever compare. I got the seared salmon over a bed of legumes, and my husband got what he quotes is still "the best burger I've ever had." Really simple sounding dishes, but with serious flavor power and skillful plate settings.

Perhaps I had an atypical experience as this place has near-perfect reviews, however, I ate at the bar and ordered the burger which arrived after an extremely long wait (the people next to me ordered a burger a solid 15 minutes after I did and they got both of their burgers before I did). I can overlook the long wait but what I absolutely cannot accept is a poorly executed burger as mine was cooked medium-well instead of medium-rare. For $32 I expect the burger to be cooked properly and to arrive in a timely manner. I did not bother having them cook another as I didn't have time.

This review is for the bar only. Prompt service and good drinks. They don't skimp on the alcohol. Restaurant vibe is lively. It's a slightly older crowd, which I appreciate at my age. I didn't have to yell to be heard. Seems like a very classic and classy establishment. Good for happy hours, drinks with friends, even a date. Would love to come back and try the food.

What a fabulous restaurant! We had a terrific meal and service here. Chef Michael Anthony made our granddaughter a Congratulations Dessert for her getting into Harvard. He was just so nice and has written two cookbooks, as far as I know. We bought "V Is For Vegetables", and we are looking forward to using it!!

Enjoyed a fantastic 3 course meal. Fantastic service and the door was spot on. I loved every course and was especially impressed by the strawberry churro. I'd highly recommend this place and will definitely visit again.

Went there for dinner tonight. From the moment we walked in, we had great service, great wine, apps, main entree and dessert. We were there for 3 hours and no one rushed us.  Highly recommend to add to your Gramercy list of restaurants.

Went for lunch with a friend who is visiting from out of town (who is also a chef). The service was impeccable, the decor elegant and earthy and the food was exceptional. We say at the bar and ordered their burger (which is not on the menu but can be made upon request) and the tomato salad with curry ricotta cheese. By far the best burger I've ever had in my life and the salad was unexpectedly delicious!

I love this place been multiple times, I've dinned in the main dining room and the tavern. In the Main dinning room, I had the tasting food was great service best I've ever had!! I do enjoy the tavern, different experiences and both amazing. Must have is the seafood tower. Cocktail list is bomb!

Timeless Perfection...I am never disappointed by the food or the service here.  When I travel to NYC and have time to sneak in a personal dinner, I head to the Tavern and pray for the good fortune to snag a seat.  My foodie karma is is good so I have lucked out many times!  This place is on my Top 10 restaurants list for good reason

I had really high expectations for this place but it was very underwhelming. The pre-fix menu of $120 comes with one appetizer, one main (same size as appetizer), and a dessert. I can't eat much but i was definitely hungry after the meal. Not to mention that the food was extremely salty....
Grilled Sea Bass was good, not the best though. Friendly staff and great service at the bar. Wait time was around 20 mins for bar seating on a weekday.

What an iconic Tavern! We did not eat here but had a drink at the bar to toast the holiday!! Very expensive. $20 for a martini, but no tipping needed. It's all included. One of those places you have to go to at least once!!!
Awesome experience yesterday at the bar. Andrew and Richard are rock stars. Had their 'special' drinks - fantastic!  Great service, great drinks, good snacks, incredibly comfortable and professional.

Gramercy Tavern has all of the makings of what makes a restaurant memorable, mind blowing, delicious, incredible and a true joy. Not only is the restaurant beautiful, but they back it up with amazing service, delectable food and an amazing ambiance. I dined alone, the staff was friendly, accommodating and delightful. The food was flavorful, decent portions for the price and works of art. I enjoyed the dining experience from start to finish and loved dining at the bar. Would absolutely return for another memorable meal.

We ate here tonight to celebrate our 20th Anniversary.  From the moment we walked in, the service and attention to detail was exceptional.  We ordered the 3 course menu and everything we ordered was delicious!  The extra touches, like champagne and a special cake to celebrate our anniversary, just made the experience all the more memorable.  I would highly recommend this place!
Amazing Food! You can't got wrong with anything on the menu. The best thing is that they hangs the menu all the time.

One of the BEST dining experiences I've had in the city of New York. It's not just the fancy setting or the fining dining. Service was so attentive, and it almost certainly made me decide to come back next year on the spot.

I have never in my life been to a restaurant that paid so much attention to detail. It opens at noon for lunch, and we were able to get a spot at the bar because we were in line outside at 11:45. We did not need a reservation to sit at the bar, however I believe one would have been necessary to have lunch in the restaurant. My boyfriend pointed out to me that this is one of the few restaurants in the country that has earned a Michelin star. I had a pumpkin soup and it was incredible! I had mint hot tea that was completely prepared behind the bar and all I had to do is pour it into my cup. My boyfriend had an incredible, grass fed beef burger which was prepared perfectly. He was even offered simple syrup as well as other accoutrements to go with his iced tea. It's also kind of cool that this is a non-tipping restaurant, as the Bartender explained to us that the employees split the profits of the restaurant.

Classic NYC. Naomi was our server and she did NOT steer us wrong on any suggestions. This was a "BALL OUT" lunch with me an my girls and GT didn't disappoint. Fab wine list to boot. Will, or course, be back for a special occasion soon... P.S. do NOT miss the burger!

You won't be disappointed. Worth the price and worth the hype. Fresh and delicious. High end dining. Decor is simple and modern and their changing menu keeps us coming back... That's for damn sure. Wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable which makes our experiences there even better.

Best restaurant!  Great service, atmosphere, clean and amazing food!  I miss their burgers and their chocolate pudding pie!!! Can't wait until the quarantine is over and they reopen.  I miss you GT and especially my favorite waiter Kevin XO
Really great service and food. Hands down THE BEST COOKIE I've ever had in my life on the dessert menu

Fine establishment.  High-end feel..but not pompous.  Prices are on the aggressive side, but gratuity is included.   The duck mousse was great.  The salad with bacon was decent..a little too much dressing.  The Wagyu cheesesteak was overcooked.  Very accommodating for GF clientele....amazing GF bread and crackers for pate'.  Nice scene too..

My favourite restaurant in NYC, same as Eleven Madsion Park in my heart! I came here before for dinner, dinner was perfect. This time came here for dessert! We got 5 dessert and EVERY one is prefect! OMG I can't describe the feeling so you must go and try their dessert!

I walked out of GT with a huge grin on my face and a full stomach. Great hospitality, great food, great ambiance...it's a great restaurant! The menu items are seasonal so there's something different to try when you visit. I can't wait to come back again!
Great restaurant, nice specials & portion sizes. The best part is that it's a no gratuity restaurant & the service is impeccable!

Booked a large group about a month in advance for a birthday celebration.  We all did the chef's tasting menu (one vegetarian).  We were greeted with a complimentary bottle of champagne.  The menu consisted of a good variety of exciting flavors and textures.  My favorite was the lobster dish.  The wait staff was almost choreographed they were so swift with serving and clearing dishes.  The decor was breathtaking with fresh cherry blossoms spread throughout.  Finally we finished with some unforgettable desserts.  One of my most memorable meals in NYC!!

I always appreciate their beautiful decor but it's their service that's top notch. One of my favorite places for a consistently excellent experience. I dined here with a friend in the restaurant industry for the tasting menu and loved it but also came on a separate more casual occasion early evening-around 5 and had a wonderful time at the bar with a few wines and small plates. All the food has always been great as long as you're prepared for the prices, prepare to enjoy wonderfully well orchestrated service. Get there early if you're trying to get a seat at the bar as it gets crowded quickly.

holy s**t! I know everyone raves about this place, but I was still caught off-guard. Attended a business dinner there the other night, and ate things that never knew would go together. Warm lobster salad? Amazing. Seabass? Good God. Even the butter they provide with the bread had me amazed. I need to come back...soon. It now makes sense. They deserve the reputation. A stunning experience.

Bland. I have no other words to say. I've heard word of mouth and read the reviews all stating the same thing, no season is used in this establishment. Now I dont know if this is only the tasting side because the other food definitely looked better. I wouldn't return to try but if you're thinking of going definitely do the normal sit down not the tasting.

Bf made reservations for my birthday last year after hearing so much about this place. Unfortunately, the food did not meet our expectation whatsoever - especially for the price point. The service was amazing but the dishes weren't palatable - a bit bland. We felt like something was missing.

One of the best tasting menus I have had in Manhattan. Came here for a business lunch once and ordered a la carte--it was only okay. But came here for dinner and did the tasting menu and my mind was blown. Will DEFINITELY return!

Easily the best restaurant in Manhattan. Been here three times now over the course of 6 years and it continuously holds to high standards. Every dish I've ever had has been exceptional. You can't go wrong here. Might be a little expensive, but it's an amazing place to spend a special night out together and eat and drink phenomenal food and cocktails.

Gramercy is truly an institution that lives up to all hype.  Tavern takes reservations but also has about 20 seats at the bar which are first come and full menu.  Food isn't too expensive given the tip is included, so a $32 burger really sits at about $27 which isn't absurd given how good it is.  Cooked perfectly medium rare and a thick cut of bacon/ham and some of the best cheese I've ever had.  Had that french onion cheese feel that gave each bite a full texture.  Juices flow and the bun was so pillowy that you could peel it layer by layer.  Sesame seed of course is way to go and meat itself was great quality.  I asked for a different side to chips and I got some pickled veggies which are on the bar menu, but I think compliment the burger well with a little sourness to the burgers savory.  Cocktails are fire and really can't go wrong with anything.  Their rendition will be one of the best of whatever you order.  I personally had a house manhattan, up, that apparently used to be on the house menu, and I know why because it was boozy, no sugar, and easy to swallow.  Great drink and great food.  Servers are busy but keep you in mind. They remember your name from the onset and monitor you like a good waiter should.  Super polite and just friendly.  I would definitely recommend the bar to anyone trying to get a New York meal.  Could easily stay here for hours drinking and eating, and though it won't be cheap, will be better off here than trying to snag a $30 cocktail or $60 steak elsewhere.

A Foodies delight.  I have eaten here several times. I wouldn't do the tasting menu if you have to be somewhere as it takes a while.  But the regular menu is so good you will be more than satisfied if you eat there.  what is really fantastic is they used to be part of restaurant week so you can get to try it out for a discounted price.  But be warned you will probably have to eat at the bar those weeks as it books up super fast.  If fact always get a reservation even for lunch.
This place has great service. Food is amazing and always great energy throughout the venue.

Always my favorite place to come for every special occasion!  Have spent many birthdays here and always love to bring family and friends as a special meal for them.   The beautiful flora arrangements and open kitchen add so much character.  I have dined in the main dinning room and the tavern.  Such a beautiful space we come from Brooklyn to dine here!

Overall fantastic experience. My fiancee and I went for dinner to celebrate the one year countdown to our wedding, and they made us feel so special from the moment we sat down. Every single person that came by the table (to clear plates, fill water, etc) was aware of our occasion and acknowledged it sincerely. Our server Ayisha was WONDERFUL. She was extremely knowledgable and took the time to explain specific dishes in elaborate detail to help us decide what to order. Every course was fantastic from the complimentary biscuits with goat cheese butter (oh. my. god.) all the way through to dessert. Highly highly recommend, especially for a special occasion. We will definitely be back!
Leo at the bar was knowledgeable and personable without being oversolicitous...and he made a mean old-fashioned! Plus -- Best whitefish I've  ever had. Lovely place. Great time!

I've been here for drinks with my Austrian friend visiting from Las Vegas. The decor is very nice and the bathrooms look so cute, it feels like you're in the country, lol. Will definitely come back for the food.

I was here on Friday night and everything I ate was a hit.   HIT!  We ordered a ton of things and all tried each other's food and we weren't disappointed by Anything.  It was all very good.  The service was ok.

Great service and ambience. However, food was mediocre. I ordered a fish entree(don't remember its exact name) and it tasted like the grilled fish you can get at any other restaurant offering American cuisine, probably even worse. For what I pay, this is not good value.

Ate at the tavern side! Seafood stew was delicious, as was the chorizo/bolognese pasta shells (although this bordered on being too salty). Service was excellent. Will have to come back and try their tasting menu soon!
Wish I could eat here everyday! Their food and service are so amazing and its worth every penny, I mean, every hundreads...

Had a wonderful lunch there earlier in the week. Food was exceptional, including the bread on the table and the complementary sparkling water. Everything was extremely fresh and nothing was over seasoned, they really let the food do the talking. I will be in that area again next month and will certainly have lunch there again.

Dining at Gramercy Tavern last night was a real treat and incredible experience. We were advised by our server Stafford, who was relaxed, fun, and generous with his time, to try two of the seasonal menus, so we could explore more of the menu. The food was delicious, intriguing, and easily the best meal I have ever had. We learned a lot about cheese and wine and more from Stafford and found our experience to be educational. At the end of the evening, Luciana Autilio stopped by to check in our experience. She was warm and friendly and made us both feel right at home. I told her that the restaurant and staff gave off the warm feel so often described in setting the table. I hope this restaurant is around for another 20 years. We will be back!

One of my favorite places to dine on this side of the pond! I ususally dine here once a month and it's still does not get old. Ask for the sommelier Alvaro! he's the best, he always ushers us into a amazing diining experiece by pairing some of the best wines with our course.
One of the best restaurants in NYC. Burger was outstanding and service was great. I will definitely comeback.

Great French country update vibe, bar area filled with beautiful flowers dining area a little more formal. They had our favorite oysters, a great fish entree for lunch and of course their home made sausage is always outstanding. Favorite and consistent go to place

Gramercy Tavern is a restaurant that absolutely is worth the hype. Came for lunch and had an absolutely wonderful experience. I had  THE burger and my fiancé had the schnitzel, both were phenomenal. We ended our meal with the chocolate pudding and a perfectly paired port (that our amazing server Kelsey recommended). It was a lunch that became an experience. Food, wine, and service just wonderful.

Ate at the bar due to the restaurant being a set pre fixe menu. Overall, this place is excellent. Bar menu was limited, but all solid options. Drinks were excellent and well prepared. Service was outstanding. This is a "no-tipping" restaurant. This place isn't cheap, so if you're on a budget I'd steer clear.
4.5.  So nice. Went on a Sunday evening.  No wait.  They don't take a res, so call before arrival to find out what the wait time is.  The prix fixe is a great deal...Just go.  You can't go wrong.

Fantastic. Each time that I have dined at (Gramercy Tavern it has been amazing. Best restaurant in NY and the World. I have been all over the world and have tasted excellent food but nothing tops the food and service at Gramercy Tavern!!!!!

Great restaurant. Service and food are outstanding. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Casual atmosphere. Great place to meet up with friends. I have been to this place many times, and always food and service came up to my expectations.

Unfortunately, while every other restaurant in the city is bending over backwards to welcome diners and do whatever it takes, Gramercy Tavern, a long-time favorite for special events, doesn't know how to address Covid-era dining. They really want to still justify Michelin-starred prices, even if the menu only has three options, but forget any semblance of the service you once expected from this fine NY institution. We're all in this together (aka I'm thrilled to be eating in the street with sirens and garbage and panhandlers, sounds great! No problem!), and I can even ignore that I'm paying $30 for pasta or a $25 cheeseburger right next to four other restaurants that charge much less to eat a cheeseburger in the street... because THIS cheeseburger is a Gramercy Tavern cheeseburger and this service is going to make me feel like I still live in the city I used to love, right? I wish we'd just gone to L'Express--they are actually happy to have diners during covid. Now is really not the time to be rude to your customers. (You might think, 'oh this is a fallout from the Danny Meyers no tipping policy' but no, they are actually rude in spite of now working for tips again.) In short, they have no idea how to actually balance "you're eating in the bike lane" with "but we're still Gramercy Tavern."

It is not surprising that the Gramercy Tavern is consistently voted the most popular restaurant in NYC. I had to deploy all my charm to book a table ;-) The neo-colonial decor is perfect, warm and welcoming; the service is attentive without being invasive. The food is close to divine: a wonderfully original beetroot, blackberries, hazelnuts and pancetta salad for starters, and a lamb loin cooked to perfection, accompanied by a fine merguez sausage, broccoli rabe and ricotta on grilled sourdough as the main course. The cheese platter did not disappoint. The wine list is good; my only small complaint is that it could be a little more extensive in the choices offered, but this is just me being pedantic! This delightful restaurant is now definitely in my New York trifeca!
It's super amazing! You should definitely have a try!And the service is perfect! The food, the wine, the atmosphere... Love it!

What strikes me every time I've dined here is that almost everyone is smiling. This is fine dining at high prices, but it's not stuffy or serious. People come here to celebrate and have a good time. The conviviality is especially evident in the tavern. The service is so friendly and professional, which certainly helps. Our dinner wasn't the best we've had here -- the cavatelli, pea shoots and cheese plate were all great but the sour of the sour cream dominagted the sundae -- but it was still a very happy occasion.

Let me start with our flight was delayed. We literally came straight from the LaGuardia bags in tow. We were a bit frazzled and on edge.
