As soon as we walked through the front door we were put at ease. Our bags and coats were checked, immediately we felt better. We were led to our table and just were able to decompress a little. We were in the city for my wife's birthday and everyone we encountered wished her a happy birthday. We had the tasting menu and wine pairing. The meal was fantastic. The atmosphere was great. Very casual, but high end. A great experience.

The food was fabulous all three in our party enjoyed their meals and I sampled everything and found it all amazing. I had a vodka martini which was well done. The service was super attentive and accommodating, however, a $500 bill for three people (only two alcoholic drinks) still seems excessive. Maybe the real issue is that I think a good family style meal with more comfortable seating ranks at the top of my list of favorites. This place would be perfect for a big date or birthday.

Gramercy Tavern is always a delight -- the food, service, and ambiance are wonderful. I was reminded today, however, that the staff makes it special. Kierstan at the front reception was extraordinarily attentive to me and my pals after some confusion about a telephone number. We are three guys of no particular importance, but Kierstan was apologetic and sympathetic and, most importantly, helpful. What a wonderful professional!
Great location, the park is just near by, food is really good but limited menu in my opinion. (For lunch) love this place anyway !
Absolutely loved it! Impeccable service, delicious tasting menus, both seasonal and vegetable. Special thanks to Anna who made the night extra special! Will definitely be back.
Nice for special occasions. Price fixed menu. Nice ambiance and very attentive wait staff. Bread would be better a bit less dense. Dessert was excellent
All in all five star experience! Danny Meyer was there with friends when we were there and was very nice to chat with!

I have always wanted to try Gramercy Tavern to see if they really live up to their high ratings, and they do! Thanks to Alessandra, our private event was organized well within the short period of time we had given her. The service was spectacular, and I honestly think that makes a huge difference. The portion sizes of our three course menu was large enough to make us all quite full. The bread was delicious and served warm. Each dish was presented very well and the timing of the dishes was spaced out perfectly, so that we didn't feel rushed whatsoever. And the flavors in each dish paired so well with each other - duck breast with strawberries and beets. I would say the appetizers and entrees tasted better than the desserts overall, but the chocolate custard dessert was very good.

Such a great culinary treat. I came here on Sunday evening for brunch and enjoyed some great beer and equally amazing food. I don't recall what I ordered but I remember how great the service was and how amazing the desert was. I'll definitely be coming back here for dinner and drinks in the near future
I ve been here 2 times and will come back 100%. Food is very nice and I like that a portions are very small but at the end you feel like you are full. Big choice of vine. Nice atmosphere for dinner.

I'm sure enough has been written about this place. None of the dishes stood out except the dessert. The dessert (strawberries with some type of shaved ice) was absolutely delicious and innovative. Just thinking about it makes my mouth water, even 2 weeks after dining here. Overall this is a great place for a fancy dinner.
Food was phenomenal, cocktails were on point and service was outstanding. It's romantic and intimate even though the space is on the larger side. I would happily return in a heartbeat.

I feel like I'm going against the grain saying Gramercy Tavern (not the Dining Room) is just ok. The appetizers were completely different sizes, and so were the mains. I wish there was a better way to delineate which were meant for single eating and which were meant for sharing. Either way we were both stuffed so there was no way dessert was happening. After NYE, I decided to go dry and get an Apple Crisp, and it's definitely the drink to go with if you're trying to look like you're drinking without having any actual alcohol. The service was on point, but the food just didn't blow me away like all the hype around it made me expect.

Extremely attentive with amazing service.  I was surprised to see that they take no tip.  Apparently, it's included in the price of the food.  I actually wanted to add more tip to the bill, but they stated it was not possible!  Everything on the tasting menu was great, except their duck was a little tough.  Overall, very tasty with stellar service and nice ambiance.

We had very high expectations before going so probably that is why we felt it was just okay. nothing impressive or extraordinary. so if you're just going for regular lunch or dinner and don't mind the price, it's a fine place to go. otherwise there are better choices.

I went just myself noon and got a table in Tavern.(rather than dinning room after I checked the menu) Ordered duck mousse and calamari fried rice. The portion is really big . Actually it's the biggest one among the Mechlin restaurants I have tried both in London and NY.  Cant say how it gets Michelin star and also 4 and half on Yelp. The service is rfriendly and I give one star for that. But the food maybe is not just my type. Asian people might have higher standard on rice. Calamari fried rice is very salty for me and oily also. Besides I don't really like the bread of duck mousse. The plate display is just Okay.

I was very excited to eat here for my birthday, and unfortunately this restaurant did not nearly meet my expectations. Although our first dishes were great, our second course was overly salty and simply inedible. Even worse than the food was the service (tip included). We asked the waiter about one of the drinks and he said "it tastes like penicillin," and he continued to disrespect my mother, who has a slight accent, by telling her "in a place like this you get the food you get." After we told him we didn't like the dish, he asked us if we wanted to take it home. The food and the service was just unacceptable for a restaurant of this standard.

My brother and I stopped for a quick lunch and food was great. Loved the ambiance and decor and even though the prices are a bit on the high side, tip in included! What I likes most is after you pay there is no additional line on the receipt to con you into leaving additional tip, you sign and go, honesty is admirable.

Sat at the bar.  Ordered the burger, was so so.  Not worth the price and hype.  Better burger  at a traditional pub.  The desert we ordered had caramel popcorn, awful.  Being creative is important, but the flavors have to come together. Service was good, the bar is a frenzy for seats. Not relaxing.  It's more of a pub with overpriced food and decor

The seasonal tasting menu for lunch is one of the best deals in the city ($55 to $65). Service is better than any fine dining restaurant I've been to (including Eleven Madison) - I think it was the best service I've ever had at any restaurant in the city. No music in the dining room - may be a good thing depending on preference. Expansive drinks menu. Food's great. I've had better vegetarian meals elsewhere but combined with the service, it's hard to find a better overall dining experience in NYC. Four and a half stars is a good assessment.

Was not impressed with the food or the service - I went in knowing I'd pay a steep ticket, but had the expectation the food would be well worth it. The hype failed to hold water in my book - my hopes were far from met. Server was curt and acted put out. Never opposed to give a place a second chance, but it feels like this place has seen its best days. New York offers far better food and service for the money.

Came here for lunch and loved the food here. It was very different than what we usually eat but it was amazing. Staff are awesome and friendly too. Would recommend booking to come at least once when you're in New York

Love this beautiful location & of course their delicious food!  There's so much about this place you can enjoy..  good food, nice staff and the bar!  They offer regular menu as well as tasting menu and it is a must try!

Beautiful, cozy brunch place. Amazing service and food was top notch. Not a bad seat in the house and waitstaff is attentive and doesn't rush you out despite being a popular place. Love the decor. Can't wait to come back!
Amazing food and great service. Course dinner can take a fairly long time to complete the cycle so make sure you planned for extra time. Hands down that the food is amazing.
not a lot that I can add to what likely has been said.  however if you go here, just get the tasting menu and wine pairing and call it a day.  you won't be disappointed.

Hands down my favorite restaurant in NYC. We did the food & wine pairing, The food was outstanding as was the wine. The service was spectacular too. The place itself is a bit pretentious and the hostess was slightly rude but the food is so outstanding, I quickly forgot about her mannerisms. I want to go back so bad, but it's so pricey!

Just a fantastic fantastic place. The dining room is over the top. Bar is great food and a nice vibe. We had the meatloaf, an a, the burger, an a, the heirloom carrots which were unlike anything I've ever had anywhere. I think they were sous vided with mint, but I just have no idea how they,are them. Just a fantastic meal.
Absolutely wonderful! Perfectly casual but upscale restaurant with impeccable food & service. Venison was superb!
